0.title: DC-PBKS match shifted from Pune to Mumbai after 5 DC members test COVID-19 positive
0.article_body: The BCCI has announced that the DC-PBKS match will be held in Mumbai instead of Pune on April 20 to avoid any further incident due to any undetected case during a long-distance bus journey in a closed environment. This comes after five members of DC's contingent, including all-rounder Mitchell Marsh, tested positive for COVID-19.

1.title: Bail denied to jeweller who bought jewellery stolen from Sonam's home
1.article_body: A Delhi court denied bail to a jeweller who allegedly bought jewellery stolen from Bollywood actor Sonam Kapoor's home in Delhi. While rejecting the plea, the court cited police's objection to the bail because some jewellery was yet to be recovered from him. Stolen jewellery worth over ₹1 crore, including 100 diamonds and six gold chains, was recovered from him.

2.title: India world's largest producer of milk; turnover more than wheat, rice output: PM
2.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said India produces milk worth ₹8.5 lakh crore annually, more than the turnover of wheat and rice. "Today, India is the world's largest producer of milk...Small farmers are the biggest beneficiaries of the dairy sector," the PM added. PM Modi was inaugurating a new dairy complex at Banas Dairy in Gujarat's Banaskantha district.

3.title: B'luru Whitefield area to face power cuts from 10 am-5 pm till Thurs
3.article_body: Bengaluru's Whitefield area will witness power interruptions till Thursday (April 21) due to the cabling work by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited. According to BESCOM, the areas will face power cuts from 10 am to 5 pm. The affected areas include Channasandra, VSR layout, Koralur, Hosahalli, Prithvi Layout, Whitefield Main road, Upkar Layout, Prashanth Layout and Swami Vivekananda Road.

4.title: Woman returning home from work crushed by BBMP garbage truck, dies
4.article_body: A 40-year-old woman bank employee who was returning home from work on Monday was crushed by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's garbage truck in Bengaluru. The woman was returning from work on a scooter when the garbage truck knocked her down from behind and ran her over. Police have shifted the woman's body to the Victoria Hospital on Mysuru road.

5.title: Rajasthan makes licence mandatory for keeping cows at home in urban areas
5.article_body: A yearly licence and a 100 square yard area will now be mandatory in Rajasthan for keeping cows or buffaloes at homes that fall in urban areas, the state government said. As per the order, penalty of up to ₹10,000 will be imposed on owners if the animals are found straying. However, the rules will not apply to registered gaushalas.

6.title: SP leader booked for threatening to read Quran in front of temples
6.article_body: An FIR has been registered against Samajwadi Party leader Rubina Khanum for allegedly making proactive speeches. Khanum said if no action is taken against groups installing loudspeakers outside mosques to play the Hanuman Chalisa, hundreds of Muslim women would recite Quran in front of temples. Khanum alleged that attempts were being made to target Muslims by banning loudspeakers outside mosques.

7.title: 3 RSS workers held for murder of PFI leader in Palakkad
7.article_body: Kerala Police arrested three RSS workers for the murder of the Popular Front of India (PFI) leader, A Subair, which took place last week in Palakkad, on Tuesday. According to ADGP Vijay Sakhare, the killing of Subair was an act of revenge for an RSS worker's murder in November last year. The accused are identified as Ramesh, Arumughan and Saravanan.

8.title: Bihar govt makes arrangements to quickly ferry kids with AES for treatment
8.article_body: Bihar government has made arrangements of linking an auto-rickshaw with every panchayat to quickly ferry children suffering from acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) to the nearest health facility, officials said on Monday. The arrangements have been made across 12 districts. According to Additional Director (Health), an ambulance has also been attached to every PHC to transport patients.

9.title: Kerala HC refuses to interfere in interfaith marriage
9.article_body: The Kerala High Court on Tuesday refused to interfere in an interfaith marriage between a Muslim man and a Christian woman. It is the woman's will and pleasure, noted the court. The habeas corpus plea demanding the woman to be produced before the court was filed by the woman's father, who alleged that his daughter had been illegally detained.

10.title: I was completely terrified, my heart was racing: Suryakumar on Kohli sledging him
10.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli sledging him in an IPL 2020 match, Suryakumar Yadav said, "His sledging was on another level." "I was chewing gum and looked composed...but on the inside I was completely terrified. My heart was racing," he added. "The voice inside me was screaming [to myself], 'Bro I beg you, please don't say anything'," Suryakumar further stated.

11.title: Ukrainian soldier escapes death as his phone stops bullet fired by Russians
11.article_body: A purported video has surfaced on social media that showed a Ukrainian soldier pulling out a smartphone from his pocket that had a bullet lodged inside it. The soldier had a narrow escape from death as the clip showed the smartphone with a 7.2 mm bullet, that was fired by the Russian troops at him, peeking from its one end.

12.title: IMF appreciates India's help to Sri Lanka amid its worst economic crisis
12.article_body: The chief of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has appreciated India's help to Sri Lanka in the country's fight against its worst economic crisis since independence. Kristalina Georgieva also assured Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman that the financial institution will continue to actively engage with the island nation. India has sent diesel and petrol and offered financial aid to Sri Lanka.

13.title: SBI asks FRL about steps taken to get back stores from Reliance: Report
13.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) has written a letter to Future Retail (FRL) seeking accountability on the takeover of the company's stores by Reliance Industries, BloombergQuint reported. SBI has asked FRL what steps it has taken to safeguard lenders' interests and the efforts taken to get back its assets from Reliance. Reliance took over 947 Future Group stores last month.

14.title: Big B shares fan artwork day after defending another fan's work
14.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan on Monday shared fan-made artwork on Instagram showing him and his son Abhishek Bachchan's faces over cartoon bodies. This comes a day after one of his fan pages criticised artwork done by another fan account saying the creator shouldn't use the actor's face over someone else's body. Amitabh had tweeted, "I like it...Please do...more...Don't pay attention to others."

15.title: Ashwin said 'I was too busy in shoots', then bowled 3 hours in nets: Kaif
15.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has praised RR spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, stating that the 35-year-old is a "genuine wicket-taker, who keeps adding new things". "Ashwin was with me at DC...and I remember...[a] game at the Wankhede [where] he leaked many runs...He felt he was too busy in shoots...[and then] bowled for almost three hours in the nets," recalled Kaif.

16.title: Cong seeks disqualification of its two Rajkot corporators for joining AAP
16.article_body: The Congress has written to the Commissioner of the Rajkot Municipal Corporation requesting him to disqualify two Congress corporators who joined AAP last week. Congress' Rajkot city unit President Pradeep Trivedi alleged that the duo, Vashram Sagathiya and Komal Bharai, were elected as corporators on Congress tickets and therefore, they should be disqualified for joining another party.

17.title: Lay down your weapons immediately: Russia to Ukraine forces
17.article_body: Russia has called on Ukrainian forces to "immediately lay down arms". This comes as Russia launched a new offensive in east Ukraine. Meanwhile, blasts were also heard in Kharkiv in the northeast, Mykolaiv in the south and Zaporizhzhia in the southeast while air raid sirens were also going off in main centres near the front line, officials and media said.

18.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.1%, EMIs to go up
18.article_body: India's biggest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across all loan tenors. With the increase, EMIs will go up for those borrowers who availed loans on MCLR. After the SBI, Kotak Mahindra, and Bank of Baroda, Axis Bank also announced an increase in MCLR.

19.title: 8 injured as 2 TMC groups clash near MP's house in Kolkata; 6 arrested
19.article_body: A clash broke out between two groups of the Trinamool Congress (TMC), who had been trying to take control of the construction business in a locality in Kolkata's Lake Gardens area. Six persons have been arrested in connection with the incident, which left at least eight injured. The incident took place near TMC MP Sougata Roy's residence.

20.title: Scientists name new millipede species Nannaria swiftae after Taylor Swift
20.article_body: Scientists have discovered 17 new species of millipedes living in Appalachian Mountains of the US and named one of them Nannaria swiftae after singer-songwriter Taylor Swift. As per the scientists, the species is named after Taylor "in recognition of her talent as a songwriter and performer and in appreciation of the enjoyment her music has brought [scientist Derek Hennen]".

21.title: No safe corridors agreed for third straight day: Ukraine Dy PM
21.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Tuesday said that the country was for the third straight day unable to secure Russia's agreement to establish any humanitarian corridors to evacuate trapped civilians. She added that "difficult negotiations" were taking place to try to arrange humanitarian corridors in the southern region of Kherson and in the Kharkiv region of eastern Ukraine.

22.title: Chef found part of Depp's finger in kitchen: Doctor on actor's fight with Heard
22.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actor's doctor said that a chef found part of Depp's finger in the kitchen, where the two were fighting. Depp told hospital workers he cut himself with a knife, the doctor said. Earlier, Depp said Heard threw a vodka bottle at him, which led to the finger getting cut off.

23.title: Nothing to say: Ex-Twitter CEO on why he didn't do anything about 'dysfunctional' board
23.article_body: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey tweeted that their board has "consistently been the dysfunction" of the company, a US journalist argued why he hadn't done anything about it when he ran the firm. Replying to him, Dorsey tweeted, "So much to say…but nothing that can be said." Dorsey's remarks come amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter.

24.title: Allu Arjun rejects a large amount to endorse tobacco product: Report
24.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun has declined to become the face of a tobacco company despite being offered "a hefty sum", according to a report. "He rejected it without a second thought as he personally doesn't consume it. [He] doesn't want his fans to watch the ad and start consuming the product, which can lead to addiction," Pinkvilla said quoting a source.

25.title: Tripura govt orders mass execution of pigs amid African Swine Fever outbreak
25.article_body: After Mizoram, Tripura government has now detected cases of African Swine Fever (ASF) at an Animal Resources Development Department-run breeding farm in the state. Over 60 pigs reportedly died due to unknown reasons, raising an alarm about the virus. Following the detection of cases, Tripura has ordered a mass execution of pigs in different phases.

26.title: Don't want to play friend who drives hero to girlfriend’s house: Anant Vidhaat
26.article_body: Actor Anant Vidhaat said that he does not want to play the role of a friend who drives the hero to his girlfriend's house. "I better engage myself doing theatre than doing those roles," he said, adding, "After Sultan, I was mostly getting roles of hero's friend." Anant said that Yash Raj Films gave him a good platform.

27.title: Boney Kapoor shares throwback pic of Arjun Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor
27.article_body: Boney Kapoor took to Instagram on Tuesday to share an old picture of Arjun Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor. "Arjun and Janhvi in a playful mood in Burlington (Vermont, USA) during the shooting of our film 'KHUSHI'," he captioned the post. 'Khushi', starring Fardeen Khan and Kareena Kapoor, was released in 2003. The film was produced by Boney.

28.title: Kiara Advani visits the Golden Temple as she shoots for her film RC 15
28.article_body: Kiara Advani, who's currently shooting for her upcoming film 'RC 15', in Amritsar recently shared a post from her visit to the Golden Temple. Taking to Instagram, Kiara shared two pictures of herself standing with her hands folded in front of the shrine. The actress donned a white kurta paired with a yellow dupatta. Alongside the post, she wrote, "Gratitude."

29.title: Waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers: SC tells banks
29.article_body: The Supreme Court has directed banks to waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers with outstanding loans and standardise their accounts. "No penalty will be charged from the homebuyers by banks since the default was on part of the builder and not by the buyers," the bench said. In 2019, the court cancelled the registration of Amrapali Group for defrauding homebuyers.

30.title: Sounds high: Musk on Meta spending $26.8 mn on Zuckerberg's security
30.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk in response to a story on Meta spending $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021 said, "Sounds high." The figure was reportedly 6% higher than $25.3 million spent in 2020. Private travel and costs associated with security protocols due to the COVID-19 were cited as reasons for such costs in 2021.

31.title: 4 kids injured in Chhattisgarh as Anganwadi building's tiles fall on them
31.article_body: As many as four children were injured at an Anganwadi in Chhattisgarh’s Bhainsbod, after tiles of the building fell over them, Janmejay Mahobe, Balod DM and Collector, said. "We'll look into the cause...Repair work will be done wherever it’s required at the Anganwadis," Mahobe added. A meeting was held to review the condition of the Anganwadis, Mahobe stated.

32.title: Indian economy will be worse than Sri Lanka, Ukraine with riots politics: Raut
32.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that India's economy will be worse than that of Sri Lanka and Ukriane with the "politics of riots". "In big cities of the country...the way situation is tense or such a situation has been created, it's highly unfortunate...Riots are happening in national capital. Delhi is a centre-administered state...it is a union territory," he added

33.title: Japan invents electric chopsticks that make food seem 1.5 times saltier
33.article_body: Japanese researchers have developed electric chopsticks that enhance the taste of salt in food by 1.5 times to reduce sodium levels in the food. The device that comes with a mini-computer worn on a wristband, uses a weak electrical current to transmit sodium ions from food via chopsticks to the mouth, thus creating a sense of saltiness, a researcher said.

34.title: Anuj, Suyash have created positive impact on games: Maxwell
34.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has praised teammates Anuj Rawat and Suyash Prabhudessai for their performances in the ongoing IPL season, stating that the youngsters have "created a positive impact" on the games despite not scoring too many runs. Rawat, who is RCB's opening batter, has scored 125 runs in six matches while Suyash has scored 40 runs in two games.

35.title: PM failed to achieve targets of economic growth in 8 yrs: Subramanian Swamy
35.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy said in eight years in office, PM Narendra Modi has failed to achieve targets of economic growth. "On the contrary, the growth rate has declined annually since 2016," Swamy tweeted. "Modi inexplicably is clueless about China. There is scope to recover but does he know how?" Swamy added.

36.title: IMD predicts cloudy sky with light rain in Delhi on Wednesday and Thursday
36.article_body: Following heatwave conditions on Tuesday, the IMD has predicted a "generally cloudy sky with light rain or drizzle" in Delhi on Wednesday and Thursday. The maximum temperature is likely to decrease from 42°C on Tuesday to 41°C on Wednesday and 39°C on Thursday. The IMD has predicted thunderstorm and lightning over Western Himalayan region and adjoining plains during April 19-21.

37.title: Netherlands head coach Ryan Campbell in induced coma following heart attack
37.article_body: Netherlands head coach and ex-Australia wicketkeeper Ryan Campbell is in induced coma in ICU in UK after suffering a heart attack. The 50-year-old was at a playground with his children when he collapsed. "[We're] in shock to hear of Ryan's medical emergency after suffering a major heart attack over the long weekend," Western Australian Cricket Association CEO Christina Matthews said.

38.title: Go First flight to Delhi stopped at Srinagar airport after bomb call
38.article_body: A Go First flight was halted at the Srinagar airport on Monday after a manager of another airline received a call about a bomb on board, PTI reported. The flight was headed for New Delhi. Inspector General of Police Vijay Kumar said the plane was searched but no explosives were found, adding that the incident was being investigated.

39.title: Had suggestions in Thar, he rejected it; did it his way: Anil on Harsh Varrdhan
39.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said that while he was shooting for 'Thar' with son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor, he had some suggestions. "But he rejected it. He did it in his own way, and he was right and I was wrong. I really enjoyed working with him," Anil said, adding that Harsh Varrdhan is fearless and he is proud of him.

40.title: Massive fire breaks out at plastic factory in Ludhiana, 2 severely injured
40.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a plastic factory in Ludhiana on Monday evening and two labourers, aged 18 and 40, were severely injured, officials said. The victims had suffered third-degree burns on their face, chest and legs, a hospital's deputy medical superintendent said. "It took around half an hour to bring the flames under control," an official added.

41.title: Wherever there is encroachment, bulldozers should be used: MoS Lekhi
41.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi on Tuesday said that bulldozers should be used to remove encroachments. "Whenever there is an encroachment on public property, it's important to remove it," Lekhi said. Talking about Delhi's Jahangirpuri incident that took place on Hanuman Jayanti, Lekhi said, "It's a conspiracy...to promote enmity to hamper law and order."

42.title: More hepatitis cases in young UK children likely to emerge: WHO
42.article_body: The UK is likely to see a rise in cases of hepatitis in young children in the coming days, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said. Recently, UK reported 74 hepatitis cases. Out of these, some children were transferred to specialist liver units, while six underwent liver transplantation. "The cause of...current hepatitis cases is...unknown and remains under active investigation," WHO added.

43.title: China to send next new space station crew for 6 months in June
43.article_body: China will launch three more astronauts to its newest space station in June for a period of six months. The crew will add two modules to the station, Director of the China Manned Space Engineering Office said. The core module of the Tiangong was launched in April 2021. China plans to complete the station by end of this year.

44.title: Siblings aged 3 & 6 drown in canal in Pune; bodies recovered
44.article_body: The bodies of two siblings, aged three and six, were recovered on Monday night after they drowned in a canal in Pune's Sortapwadi. Police believe that the children were riding a bicycle near the canal and had fallen in after losing control. The children's family had found the bicycle and footwear at the banks of the canal during a search.

45.title: Brain-dead patient's kidneys, lungs and liver donated to save 4 lives in Mumbai
45.article_body: The kidneys, lungs and liver of a critical patient of CritiCare Asia Multi-Specialty Hospital in Mumbai were donated, which saved the lives of four other persons. The patient's organs were transplanted to other hospitals in the city. The family members of the donor, who was declared brain-dead on March 26, were counselled to opt for organ donation.

46.title: KTR inaugurates Skywalk at Mindspace campus in Hyderabad
46.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday inaugurated a one kilometre long Skywalk at Hyderabad's Mindspace campus. The Skywalk connects the Raidurg Metro Station to strategic locations in and around the Mindspace Madhapur campus and is expected to ease commute for around 30,000 people on a daily basis. It has been designed keeping in mind people with disabilities.

47.title: Attacking police station is serious crime: Bommai on Hubbali stone-pelting incident
47.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the investigation into the stone-pelting incident at Old Hubbali Police Station, in which 12 policemen were injured, is being carried out thoroughly. "Attacking the police station is a serious crime, action will be initiated against the guilty," he added. According to Hubbali Police commissioner, 88 persons have been arrested in the matter so far.

48.title: Temple shut to prevent groom's entry in MP: Scheduled Caste body
48.article_body: A Scheduled Caste organisation on Monday claimed that "influential people" had closed a temple in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain to prevent the entry of a groom, who's a police constable. However, a police officer said that the Rajput community submitted documents claiming they had built the temple and it was closed due to the priest's family member's death.

49.title: I know we lost but keep your chins up: Shah Rukh Khan after RR defeat KKR
49.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan motivated his IPL team Kolkata Knight Riders as it lost to Rajasthan Royals on Monday. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Well played boys. Stupendous effort by @ShreyasIyer15 @AaronFinch5 @y_umesh congrats to #SunilNarine for the 150th match...I know we lost but if we've to go down this is the only way to do it! Keep your chins up."

50.title: Zilingo board considering replacing Indian-origin CEO amid probe: Report
50.article_body: Singapore's fashion startup Zilingo's board is discussing replacing Indian-origin CEO Ankiti Bose after suspending her earlier this month amid an investigation into the startup's accounting practices, Bloomberg reported. Bose, whose current suspension runs through May 5, has reportedly asked the board to clarify her status. The board has not yet decided who will replace Bose.

51.title: California teen with autism who went missing 3 years ago found alive
51.article_body: A California teenager who went missing nearly three years ago was found alive on April 9, sleeping in a convenience store in Utah's Summit County. Connerjack Oswalt was reported missing in September 2019, when he was 16 years old. Oswalt has now been reunited with his family, "who was losing hope", Summit County Sheriff said in a Facebook post.

52.title: 3 explosions hit school in Afghanistan
52.article_body: Three explosions hit a school in Afghanistan's Kabul on Tuesday, killing several people, according to Afghan security and health officials. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the attack. Many residents in the neighbourhood belong to the Shia Hazara community, an ethnic and religious minority frequently targeted by Sunni militant groups, including Islamic State.

53.title: Will Ram Navami processions be taken out in Pak if not in India: Giriraj
53.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Giriraj Singh asked if Ram Navami processions should be taken out in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan if not in India. "Had processions of any other faith...been attacked, leaders like Rahul Gandhi and ailing (RJD President) Lalu Prasad...would have hit the streets for their political tourism," he added.

54.title: Afghanistan gets 30 tonnes of food and relief supplies from UAE
54.article_body: Afghanistan received 30 tonnes of food and relief supplies from the UAE amid the humanitarian situation in the country. An aircraft carrying the supplies reached Kabul on Monday. A Taliban spokesperson reportedly said that the supplies will be distributed among the vulnerable people by the government. He further called for unconditional aid, devoid of any political motive.

55.title: Ram Charan gets mobbed by fans in Amritsar, video surfaces
55.article_body: Ram Charan, who was most recently seen in 'RRR', was mobbed by fans in Amritsar, where he's shooting for Shankar's project. In a video, the actor can be seen surrounded by fans, who're chanting his name loudly. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Man of...masses," while another fan wrote, "Can't wait to see similar visuals in London, New York."

56.title: Silly mistakes and not handling pressure well cost us game vs RR: McCullum
56.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said a couple of silly mistakes and not handling pressure as well as they should have, cost them the game against RR. "We were trying to hold Cummins for the seamers...Mavi's role was to...get through [Yuzvendra Chahal]. Unfortunately, we weren't able to execute [that]," he added. RR's Chahal picked four wickets in KKR's 17th over.

57.title: Instagram rolls out product tagging for public account users in US
57.article_body: Instagram has enabled tagging products in feed posts for all public account users in the US. In a blog post, Instagram explained how the feature would work and said that the idea behind this is to support small businesses and help them get traction. The platform also said they are working on ways for users to tag products in Stories.

58.title: Jack Ma's Ant to be payments platform 2C2P's largest shareholder
58.article_body: Jack Ma-owned Ant Group will become the majority investor in Singapore-based payments platform 2C2P as part of a partnership. The deal will lead to the integration of Ant's Alipay+ payment service with 2C2P's platform used by merchants in Asia, Europe, the Middle East and the Americas. "Through this...partnership...2C2P will be connected to a much larger merchant base," 2C2P CEO said.

59.title: Man, others beat wife, force her to marry alleged lover in Tripura
59.article_body: A woman was allegedly beaten up and forced to marry her "lover" on suspicion of having an extra-marital affair in Tripura's Khowai, police said on Monday. The woman told reporters that her husband along with 15 others had thrashed her until she lost consciousness. The police haven't received a written complaint, but will investigate the matter, a police officer said.

60.title: 5 of family from Rajasthan killed, 2 missing as car falls into canal in Punjab
60.article_body: Five members of a family from Rajasthan were killed as the car they were travelling in was hit by a speeding bus and fell into a canal on Ropar-Chandigarh Highway in Punjab, police said. The search to recover the bodies of two others is on, police added. "After collision...driver lost control...ended up hitting the railing of the bridge," police stated.

61.title: Bride slaps groom twice, storms off stage during jaimala ceremony in UP; video goes viral
61.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a bride slapping the groom twice and walking off the stage during jaimala ceremony in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district. As per reports, the bride did not like the groom. Local police intervened to bring the situation under control, reports added. The two sides later reached an agreement, reports further stated.

62.title: Pakistan President refuses to administer oath to new cabinet: Reports
62.article_body: The oath-taking ceremony of the new Pakistan federal cabinet has been postponed after President Arif Alvi reportedly refused to administer the oath to them. A notification revealed the names of 30 federal ministers who were to take oath in PM Shehbaz Sharif-led federal cabinet. Imran Khan was removed as Pakistan PM after he lost the no-trust vote against him.

63.title: MP govt land worth ₹300 crore free from encroachment in Bhopal
63.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government's land worth ₹300 crore has been freed from encroachment in Bhopal, an official said on Tuesday. A woman had been allegedly selling shops, that were constructed illegally on this land, and an FIR will be filed against her, an official statement said. The encroached land was in the Chuna Bhatti area, the statement added.

64.title: Mandakini to make a comeback after 26 years, to star in son's music video
64.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini, who quit the film industry in 1996, is making a comeback with a music video, which will also feature her son Rabbil. The song is about a mother and is titled 'Maa O Maa', director Sajan Agarwal said. "[It's] a very beautiful song and I instantly fell in love with it," Mandakini said.

65.title: Mumbai man gets ₹7.5 lakh prize money letter, ends up losing ₹16 lakh
65.article_body: A 32-year-old Mumbai-based man had received a postal letter, which mentioned a lucky draw from a known online shopping portal with a scratch card in it. On scratching the card, it showed that he had become a lucky winner of ₹7.50 lakh cash prize. The accused induced the victim to pay ₹16 lakh in order to claim the prize.

66.title: Destroyed foreign weapons stored near Ukraine's Lviv city: Russia
66.article_body: Russia carried out airstrikes at a logistics centre of the Ukrainian Army near Lviv city and destroyed large quantities of foreign weapons stored there, Russia's Defence Ministry said. The weapons had entered Ukraine in the last six days from America and European nations, it added. In total, 16 Ukrainian military sites were destroyed by Russia on Monday, it further said.

67.title: Deleted, was creating chaos: MP BJP chief's wife on Hindu-Muslim unity tweet
67.article_body: Madhya Pradesh BJP chief VD Sharma's wife Stuti Mishra said that she has deleted her tweet on 'Hindu-Muslim unity' because it was creating "unnecessary chaos". "It's difficult to share thoughts on a topic of religious fight. Was not [aimed] to hurt anyone's opinion. Let karma do the rest," she said. She had earlier tweeted about a "caring" Muslim shopkeeper.

68.title: PM Modi-led govt’s ‘Swachh Bharat’ campaign changed lives of people: BJP
68.article_body: The Centre has built toilets in over 11.5 crore households under the 'Swachh Bharat' mission, the BJP said on Monday. PM Narendra Modi has worked to fulfil Mahatma Gandhi’s dreams about cleanliness and has effected change in the lives of people, the BJP stated. PM Modi launched the campaign on October 2, 2014.

69.title: UP govt allows maximum 1 month casual leave for employees infected with COVID-19
69.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has issued orders allowing its employees to go on a special causal leave, if infected with COVID-19. As per the order, employees infected with COVID-19 can be given the special leave for a maximum period of one month. The order mentions that this leave can be incurred by infected employees at any time.

70.title: 7 more die of COVID-19 in Shanghai
70.article_body: A day after the first deaths in months were reported, seven more people died in Shanghai due to COVID-19. According to the Chinese government, all of the deceased were elderly aged between 60 and 101 years. "The seven people's condition worsened after being admitted to hospital and they died after the rescue failed," said the government.

71.title: Plan on for 'Dilli Shopping Festival' to create 2 mn jobs: Delhi govt
71.article_body: The Delhi government has begun planning the 'Dilli Shopping Festival', one of the key initiatives announced in its Budget to facilitate 2 million jobs this year, an official statement said. The Arvind Kejriwal-led government, which kept 'rozgar' as its budget theme this year, aims to create 1,20,000 jobs through organising retail and wholesale shopping festivals, as per the budget documents.

72.title: Chhattisgarh CM warns govt doctors against prescribing branded medicines
72.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday warned government doctors against prescribing branded medicines. The warning came while the CM was reviewing the 'Shri Dhanwantari Generic Medical Store Scheme' which ensures availability of generic medicines at affordable rates. According to officials, district collectors and Chief Medical and Health Officers have been asked to ensure strict compliance.

73.title: Class 10 Dalit boy beaten with belt, made to lick feet in UP; 7 arrested
73.article_body: A video has surfaced which purportedly shows a Class 10 Dalit student being beaten up with belts in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli. The video shows that the boy was forced to lick the feet of an accused. SP Shlok Kumar said the main accused is a minor and has been sent to a juvenile home while six others have been arrested.

74.title: I am doing my own biopic: Lalit Modi on reports of film being made on him
74.article_body: Former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi responded to reports of a film being made about him. In two separate posts, he wrote, "Surprised to see my name associated with some book soon to be a movie. I've NOTHING...to do with this film or book...Just to be clear- I'm doing my own." He added that he'll announce it in a few weeks.

75.title: Chhattisgarh man found dead days after meeting CM, Union Minister
75.article_body: The body of a 35-year-old man was found in Chhattisgarh's Kolaiguda on Sunday, days after he met Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel and Union MoS for Tribal Affairs Renuka Singh, demanding rehabilitation as he fled his village following Salwa Judum violence. Police believe he could have been killed due to personal reasons. They also suspect Maoists' role in his death.

76.title: KKR looked likely to win with more than an over to spare, loss will hurt: Ojha
76.article_body: Reacting to KKR's defeat by seven runs against RR, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said the loss will "hurt" KKR considering a win for them with more than an over to spare seemed likely at one stage. RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal recorded a five-wicket haul, including a hat-trick, to help his franchise win their fourth match in the tournament.

77.title: When RCB picked Karthik in mega auction, we all wondered why: Manjrekar
77.article_body: Talking about RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said, "When RCB picked Karthik [in] the IPL mega auction, we were all wondering why." "It seemed like Karthik was past his prime and...was out of Team India as well. He hadn't done anything extraordinary for...KKR," added Manjrekar. Karthik has scored 197 runs in six IPL 2022 matches so far.

78.title: Du Plessis' failure so far one of the big stories of IPL 2022: Manjrekar
78.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said RCB captain Faf Du Plessis' "failure" so far in IPL 2022 is one of the big stories of the ongoing edition. Du Plessis has scored 154 runs in six IPL 2022 matches so far at a strike rate of 123.20. The South African was the second-highest run-scorer in IPL 2021 with 633 runs for CSK.

79.title: Pune requires a total firefighter strength of 1,620 but has 380: Official
79.article_body: As per Centre's fire advisory norms, Pune requires a total firefighter strength of 1,620 but has 380 at present, an official said. "Pune city requires 74 fire stations...has 14," the official added. "This acute shortfall means one station has to cater to a much larger area...firefighters are burdened with a higher load of work," Pune's Chief Fire Officer said.

80.title: If RR can get it, we can get it as well, that's how I was thinking: Shreyas
80.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said they were going well when they started chasing RR's 218-run target. "Once Finch [got] out, we slowed down a bit...I wanted to set an example, doesn't matter whatever score they get. If they can get it, I can get it as well. That's how I was thinking," he added. KKR lost by seven runs.

81.title: Tribals will continue to fight for their heritage, tradition: CPI(M) leader
81.article_body: CPI(M) West Bengal Secretary Mohammed Salim has criticised the ruling TMC government's Deucha Pachami coal block mining project in the Birbhum district. "This is the (tribals') heritage and tradition...They will fight and we will continue our support to them," Salim said. He also claimed that the Trinamool's land acquisition supporters were shown black flags by the tribals on Monday.

82.title: 2 minors among 4 arrested for 15-yr-old tribal girl's gangrape in WB's Birbhum
82.article_body: Four persons, including two minors, have been arrested in connection with the alleged gangrape of a 15-year-old tribal girl in West Bengal's Birbhum on April 14, police said. The girl was allegedly dragged to a secluded place by a group before being raped when she was returning home along with a male friend, who was also assaulted.

83.title: Didn't consider casting dad in my films: Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa
83.article_body: Filmmaker Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth said that she didn't consider casting her father, actor Rajinikanth in her films. She added, "I honestly haven't given it a thought or worked towards it. I am enjoying and loving the experience of being his fanatic fan." "But if an opportunity comes up, who in their right senses would say no to that?" Aishwaryaa said.

84.title: 2 dead, 8 hurt in shooting at party at Pittsburgh Airbnb rental
84.article_body: Two teenagers were killed and at least eight people were wounded after gunfire erupted on Sunday at a party in Pittsburgh at an Airbnb rental with as many as 200 people in attendance. As many as 90 rounds were fired inside and outside of the property. Several people jumped out of the windows, sustaining injuries such as broken bones.

85.title: Man rams car into parked milk tanker in Punjab, wife killed
85.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was killed, while her husband and son suffered injuries, after their car crashed into a milk tanker parked outside a Verka plant in Punjab. The family was returning after visiting Baba Balak Nath Temple in Himachal Pradesh, the police said. Sukhpal who was driving the car fell asleep behind the wheel and lost control of the car.

86.title: Should see 'KGF: Chapter 2' 4-5 times, won't understand it first time: Sanjay
86.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt said that everyone should watch first day first show of 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "I think everybody should see it about 4-5 times because you will not understand the film in the first go," Sanjay said. The actor was replying to a fan who said that there has been no film of Dutt he hasn't watched in theatres.

87.title: Fan's 'marriage proposal' poster for KKR captain Shreyas Iyer goes viral
87.article_body: A picture of a fan carrying a 'marriage proposal' poster for KKR captain Shreyas Iyer ahead of KKR-RR match has gone viral. "My mom has asked me to find a guy. So, will you marry me, Shreyas Iyer?" the poster read. Sharing the picture, KKR wrote, "That's one way of shooting your shot!"

88.title: Which RR bowlers have taken hat-trick in IPL history?
88.article_body: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal on Monday became the fifth Rajasthan Royals (RR) bowler to take a hat-trick in IPL history. Ajit Chandila had become the first RR bowler to take an IPL hat-trick in 2012. Pravin Tambe and Shane Watson took hat-trick against KKR and SRH, respectively, in 2014. Shreyas Gopal took a hat-trick in 2019 against RCB.

89.title: Man assumes wife acted in porn film he watched, kills her in front of kids in B'luru
89.article_body: A 40-year-old Bengaluru man killed his wife on Sunday after assuming that she acted in a porn movie that he watched two months ago. The accused named Pasha, an auto driver, allegedly beat up Mubeena at a family function in Kolar two months ago over the same issue. The two had been married for 15 years and have five children.

90.title: Hyd police nab 15 over gambling on rooster fights; ₹29,280 seized
90.article_body: Hyderabad's LB Nagar Special Operations Team has nabbed 15 people who were allegedly organising gambling on rooster fights in the forest area on the outskirts of Adibatla, the police tweeted on Tuesday. The police also recovered ₹29,280 and other items from the accused. The accused tried to escape when they noticed the police team but were caught.

91.title: Body of New York woman found in duffel bag, was stabbed 60 times
91.article_body: Police are looking for the person who stabbed a New York City woman to death and dumped her body in a duffel bag. Orsolya Gaal was killed in the basement of her home by an unidentified attacker, who then dragged her body and left it on a street corner on Saturday. The 51-year-old woman was reportedly stabbed nearly 60 times.

92.title: Lucky to have my kids know what we do: Warner on pics of daughters' reaction to dismissal
92.article_body: DC opener David Warner took to Instagram to share the viral pictures of his daughters 'heartbroken' reaction to his dismissal against RCB. He wrote, "So lucky to have my kids know what we do, but more importantly, it teaches them that you can't always win. We all give 100% every time we walk onto that field, no matter what."

93.title: Maha minister meets Baghel seeking clearances for coal block
93.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nitin Raut has sought clearances for a coal block allocated to a state-run power company in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh. He met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday to urge early completion of the formalities and reportedly sought forest diversion. The Chhattisgarh government said that the CM assured full support in the matter to Raut.

94.title: Why is PM silent on incidents of riots and violence? : Congress' Surjewala
94.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said BJP and its government are at war with its own people. "While parts of India are ravaged by riots and violence, why is the Prime Minister so conspicuously silent? Why does he not denounce hatred no matter where it comes from?" Surjewala added. "Why do perpetrators of hate get political patronage?" Surjewala stated.

95.title: MP man thrashes elder brother to death after being denied ₹100, arrested
95.article_body: Police have arrested a 48-year-old man for allegedly thrashing his elder brother to death after being denied ₹100 by him in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district, police said on Monday. The incident took place on Sunday evening. Reports said that the accused slammed his brother on the ground several times, which eventually led to his death.

96.title: 14-yr-old Hyderabad boy dies while playing, parents suspect murder
96.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died after he allegedly collapsed while playing volleyball at Moghalpura ground in Hyderabad on Saturday. According to police, preliminary reports suggest that Mohammed Nawaz died due to dehydration. However, his parents suspect it to be a murder. "A few boys playing with Nawaz claimed that others beat him up," Nawaz's father Riaz Ahmed said.

97.title: 28-yr-old man missing since communal clashes in MP's Khargone found dead
97.article_body: A 28-year-old man, who went missing following communal clashes in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone on April 10, has been found dead. The man succumbed to his injuries on April 12, but they hadn't been able to identify him for six days, police said. Police have denied the allegations of the man's family, who claimed that he was killed in police custody.

98.title: SC stays UP govt decision to take back land from Jauhar University
98.article_body: The Supreme Court stayed a decision by UP government to take back land allotted to Rampur’s Mohammad Ali Jauhar University. The university, which is run by a Trust headed by Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan, was allotted 400 acres of land in 2005. The construction of a mosque on the premises violated government's conditions, Allahabad High Court had noted.

99.title: Delhi Police arrests 5 of a family over Jahangirpuri violence
99.article_body: Delhi Police arrested five people and apprehended one minor of the same family in connection with the Jahangirpuri violence that took place in Delhi on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti. "My husband ran away...to save his life," the wife of an accused said. As many as 23 people have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended so far.

100.title: DFEH rushed to sue us for quick publicity grab: Tesla on racism suit
100.article_body: Tesla has accused the US' DFEH of abandoning its founding purpose, ignoring its statutory obligations and rushing to sue it "perhaps for a quick publicity grab". The agency had alleged Tesla ignored years of complaints about racial slurs in its California factory. Tesla also said the DFEH perhaps feared that US' EEOC would be the first to settle with Tesla.

101.title: 62-yr-old man cheated of ₹16 lakh under pretext of marriage in Pune
101.article_body: A 62-year-old man was allegedly cheated of over ₹16 lakh by a person he met on an online platform under the pretext of getting married. The man had approached the police a few months ago and a case was filed in the matter on Sunday. "[Complainant's] son is betrothed and he was afraid of sharing details," a police sub-inspector said.

102.title: Sri Lanka's state-run oil firm raises petrol prices amid economic crisis
102.article_body: Sri Lanka's state-run Ceylon Petroleum Corporation has raised the price of 92 octane petrol to LKR 338 per litre amid the nation’s worst economic crisis. This comes a day after Indian Oil Company's local operation raised its prices. Notably, this was CPC’s second price hike within a month. Sri Lanka is facing its worst economic crisis since the 1940s.

103.title: Fundamentalism more dangerous when practised by majority: Kerala minister
103.article_body: Kerala minister MV Govindan said fundamentalism is more dangerous when practised by the majority than the minority. His remark came in reaction to the killings of RSS and SDPI workers in Palakkad. He added, the majority fundamentalism "is working towards formation of a Hindu Rashtra" and the hatred towards minorities is part of the attempt to create to achieve that.

104.title: High temp, low maintenance behind rise in Delhi's fire incidents: DFS Chief
104.article_body: The Delhi Fire Service (DFS) Chief Atul Garg has said that the soaring temperatures and low fire safety maintenance in public places have led to the "spike in numbers" of Delhi's fire incidents this month. Notably, 2,219 fire calls were reported from Delhi between April 1 and 17. In 2021, the number was 3,240 for the entire April month.

105.title: 21-year-old MBBS student found hanging at her residence in Chandigarh
105.article_body: A 21-year-old MBBS student of Government Medical College and Hospital was found hanging at her residence in Chandigarh's Sector 22, police said. "The incident came to light when her mother visited her...She knocked...didn't receive any response," police added. "The mother said her daughter was scheduled to go to college for taking admission in current semester...she was nervous," police stated.

106.title: Made us proud: Akshay after R Madhavan's son Vedaant wins Gold at Danish Open
106.article_body: After actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant Madhavan bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022, several actors including Akshay Kumar and Priyanka Chopra took to Twitter to congratulate him. Akshay wrote, "These young boys Sajan and Vedaant have made us...proud. I'm sure it's an amazing feeling as a parent." Priyanka tweeted, "Congratulations Vedaant! That's an amazing feat!"

107.title: Centre notifies merger of 3 municipal corporations in Delhi into 1
107.article_body: The Central government has notified the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Act, 2022, merging Delhi's East, South, and North Delhi Municipal Corporations into one. The corporation will be known as the 'Municipal Corporation of Delhi'. The government will also appoint a special officer to discharge functions of the corporation, until the date on which the corporation's first meeting is held.

108.title: 2 students fall off moving bus' footboard in TN; video surfaces
108.article_body: A video of two students falling off a moving bus while they tried to hold onto the vehicle in Tamil Nadu's Tenkasi has surfaced online. Locals reportedly rushed the students, who suffered minor injuries after falling off the bus' footboard, to the hospital following the incident. The bus conductor claimed that the students had been trying to perform stunts.

109.title: Parents thrash groom's family after daughter elopes for marriage in Chandigarh
109.article_body: The parents of a woman, who eloped with a man for marriage in Chandigarh, allegedly thrashed the groom's family on Monday. The complainant, Rahul, said the woman's parents and their aides attacked him, his sisters and his parents after his elder brother got married to their daughter against their wish. Rahul suffered fractures in both the legs and arms.

110.title: I knew in my mind I had to take wickets to change game: Chahal on hat-trick
110.article_body: RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said he knew he had to take wickets in the 17th over against KKR to change the momentum of the game. Chasing RR's 218-run target, KKR were 178/4 after 16 overs when Chahal came and picked four wickets, including a hat-trick. "Would've been happy with a dot ball as well on my hat-trick ball," added Chahal.

111.title: Vishal Bhardwaj praises 'desi food' at Priyanka's NYC restaurant, she reacts
111.article_body: Filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj took to Twitter to share a picture from Priyanka Chopra's Indian restaurant Sona, located in New York, US. "What a lovely night with friends and the most delicious desi food with a twist in NY. #SonaNewYork," he wrote. Priyanka reacted to Vishal's post and wrote, "So glad you liked it, sir. You're welcome anytime."

112.title: We shot with 100+ dogs, it was really challenging: Arun Vijay on 'Oh My Dog'
112.article_body: While talking about 'Oh My Dog', actor Arun Vijay said it was "really challenging" to work with so many dogs at same time. "I think we shot with nearly 100+ dogs...Having said that...they seemed to have way more fun than...entire cast and crew...Hats off to Raja, the trainer...and our director Sarov to ensure that everything went on smoothly," he added.

113.title: My male friends tell me 'your mom is quite hot': Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak
113.article_body: Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari, in an interview, was asked if her male friends have ever told her that they have a crush on her mother. "They've not said...they've a crush on her, they're like 'Your mom is quite hot'," Palak said, adding, "I was like 'you say this and...my mom is gonna belo (beat with rolling pin) like that'."

114.title: Bengaluru records 51 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 2.91%
114.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 51 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). With 39 new recoveries, the active cases in the city now stand at 1,403. According to official data, the daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Bengaluru increased to 2.91% as compared to 1.48% reported on Sunday.

115.title: US drops mask mandate on trains, airplanes after court order
115.article_body: The US government ended the mask mandate for people using public transportation such as trains and airplanes. This comes after a federal judge in Florida declared the 14-month-old directive unlawful. Following the court order, major airlines such as American Airlines, United Airlines and Delta Air Lines lifted the mask mandate. The national train line Amtrak also relaxed the restrictions.

116.title: Delhi's law & order is under Centre: Sharad Pawar on Jahangirpuri violence
116.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday reacted to the violence in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession, saying that Delhi's law and order situation comes under the Central government. Pawar added, "We never heard of communal violence during Ram Navami. The reason behind this is the BJP and some of their organisation."

117.title: Haryana to grant same scholarship to general and SC players
117.article_body: Haryana government has decided to grant the same scholarship to general and SC category players. "To boost players across all categories, we have made scholarship in the general category at par with SC category players except for the ₹18,000 for participation to SC players and ₹1,000 extra for female medallists from the state," said Pankaj Nain, Director Sports, Haryana.

118.title: Ranbir holds note saying 'I pledge ₹12 lakh to all bridesmaids' during wedding; pic viral
118.article_body: A picture of Ranbir Kapoor holding a note saying 'I, Ranbir, husband of Alia, pledge ₹12 lakh to all the bridesmaids' during his wedding has gone viral. Alia Bhatt's friend Tanya Saha Gupta shared pictures from the wedding, writing, "It's sappy days like these that I live for." Alia and Ranbir got married on April 14.

119.title: CoinDCX doubles valuation to $2.15 bn, becomes India's most valuable crypto company
119.article_body: CoinDCX has raised $135.9 million in a funding round led by Pantera Capital and Steadview Capital. This led to its valuation being doubled to $2.15 billion in eight months to become the most valued cryptocurrency trading platform in India. CoinDCX plans to use its fund to increase its employees from 400 to 1000 by the end of next year.

120.title: Man in blue kurta seen opening fire during violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri arrested
120.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested 28-year-old Imam alias Sonu, who was seen in a video purportedly firing a gun during the violence at Jahangirpuri. DCP (Northwest) Usha Rangnani said, "A video was being circulated on social media showing a man in blue kurta opening fire during the riot in Jahangirpuri area."  A sophisticated pistol was recovered from his possession, police said.

121.title: Suspended principal of Mohali institute held for demanding ₹50,000 bribe
121.article_body: The vigilance bureau on Monday arrested a suspended principal of the Industrial Training Institute (Women), Phase 5, Mohali, for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹50,000 from a Ludhiana resident for helping him land an instructor’s job in the institute. The accused man, Shamsher Singh Purkhalvi, was suspended two weeks ago following a slew of complaints against him.

122.title: Girl whose pic with contact details on her back went viral escapes Ukraine war
122.article_body: A girl whose picture with contact details written on her back went viral has escaped Ukraine war along with her mother. The girl's mother Makoviy wrote the details on her back in case they were separated in the war. Makoviy confirmed that she and Vira escaped Ukraine and have been living in a French village with her mother.

123.title: US to no longer conduct anti-satellite tests, first nation to do so
123.article_body: The US has announced that it will no longer conduct anti-satellite (ASAT) missile tests, becoming the first nation to make such a declaration. Vice President Kamala Harris, who chairs the National Space Council, made the announcement. "This commitment addresses one of the most pressing threats to...security...of space, as demonstrated by Russia's...ASAT missile test," the White House said.

124.title: Karnataka govt takes 30% commission on grants reserved for mutts: Seer
124.article_body: A Lingayat seer, Dingaleshwara Swami of Balehosur Mutt, claimed that the Basavaraj Bommai-led Karnataka government takes a 30% commission on grants reserved for the welfare of mutts. "The corruption has reached this level...officials say they cannot be released until commission is paid," the seer added. "For cities like Delhi...funds are like ice creams...we get only ice cream sticks," he stated.

125.title: Ukraine shifting stance, inconsistent during peace talks: Russia
125.article_body: Russia said that Ukraine is "changing its position" on issues previously agreed upon at talks between the two sides and "the trend of the negotiating process leaves much to be desired". "The Ukrainian side isn't consistent in terms of the points that have been agreed," Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. However, Peskov said that "contacts continue at an expert level".

126.title: Fearing blackmail over obscene pics, Maha doctor hires people to beat nurse
126.article_body: A doctor and two other accused, who he hired to beat and steal mobile phone of a female nurse, have been arrested by the Ulhasnagar Police. The doctor had doubts about nurse having some obscene pictures of him and thought that she would blackmail him. Police said he gave other accused ₹10,000 to attack the nurse.

127.title: Power crisis in Maharashtra due to mismanagement of MVA govt: BJP leader
127.article_body: BJP leader Girish Mahajan alleged that power crisis in Maharashtra was caused due to "mismanagement" of the MVA government and the previous Devendra Fadnavis-led government ensured the state did not face load-shedding even for a day. "An artificial power shortage is being created, then electricity is bought at higher rates to earn commission, cuts," the BJP leader added.

128.title: Restored hope in justice system: SKM as SC cancels Ashish Mishra's bail
128.article_body: Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) on Monday said that Supreme Court has "restored hope in the justice system" by cancelling Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra's bail in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. SMK added that now Teni should be "sacked from the post of minister", failing which it'll hold a national meeting and announce a nationwide protest programme.

129.title: Hong Kong disposing over 2,000 tonnes of plastic waste daily amid COVID-19
129.article_body: Amid COVID-19, Hong Kong has been disposing over 2,300 tonnes of plastic waste a day, revealed government data. An entrepreneur while speaking from a quarantine hotel in the city said that all staff members wore PPE kits and items like phones, and remotes are cellophane wrapped. Meanwhile, a government spokesperson said officials were aware of the surge in disposable waste.

130.title: Chahal and Buttler's performances were there for the world to see: Samson
130.article_body: Speaking at the post-match ceremony after their 7-run win against KKR, RR captain Sanju Samson said, "Yuzvendra Chahal and Jos Buttler's performances were there for the world to see." He added, "Halfway, I thought [our total] was chaseable. KKR played very well...but the wickets helped." Chahal took a hat-trick in his five-wicket haul while Buttler scored 103(61) in the game.

131.title: Umran Malik scares you the same way Jofra Archer does: Ian Bishop
131.article_body: Former West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said SRH pacer Umran Malik's bowling is as scary as that of England fast bowler Jofra Archer and New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson. "It is just fascinating to me what Umran can become," added Bishop. "He's bowling with hostility which means even the best of batters will be uncomfortable facing him," stated Bishop.

132.title: Dejected parties taking refuge in vote bank, divisive politics: Nadda
132.article_body: Reacting to Opposition parties' joint statement criticising Centre over incidents of communal violence, BJP President JP Nadda said, Opposition is "casting aspersions on our hardworking citizens". Unfortunately, this thrust towards development politics is being bitterly resisted by "rejected and dejected parties" which are "once again taking refuge in vote bank and divisive politics", he added.

133.title: 6 killed, several injured as bus crashes into SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria
133.article_body: Six people died and several others were left injured after a collision between an SUV and a bus in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria on Monday late night. The incident took place when the SUV carrying passengers was returning from a Tilak ceremony. "The bus came from the opposite direction and rammed into the vehicle," Deoria Superintendent of Police Shripati Mishra said.

134.title: Police lathi-charge PHE daily wage workers during protest in J&K
134.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir police on Monday lathi-charged some Public Health Engineering (PHE) daily wage workers during their protest for regularisation and release of pending wages in Jammu. The protesters were intercepted by police while they were marching towards Raj Bhawan. "BJP government has betrayed us and if they fail to fulfil our demands...then we'll stop supplying water," a protester said.

135.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels agree to stop using child soldiers: UN
135.article_body: Yemen's Houthi rebels have agreed to stop using child soldiers in armed conflicts, the United Nations has said. A UN official said that the rebels agreed to identify and release children from their ranks within six months. The action plan, which the UN said Houthis signed, also calls for preventing violence against children and attacks on hospitals and schools.

136.title: He only plays 5 or 10 balls every match: Malinga on Riyan Parag's form
136.article_body: Talking about RR batter Riyan Parag, their fast-bowling coach Lasith Malinga said there's no concern over the 20-year-old's form. "He hasn't got much chance...he just plays five or 10 balls every match," stated Malinga. Parag was dismissed for 5 off 3 balls against KKR on Monday and has scored a total of 48 runs in six games so far.

137.title: Ashwin's running celebration after dismissing Russell for golden duck goes viral
137.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's running celebration after dismissing Andre Russell for a golden duck with a carrom ball has gone viral. After Russell got clean bowled, Ashwin was seen running with both his hands pointing towards him. Ashwin registered figures of 4-0-38-1 in the match, which RR won by seven runs.

138.title: Shreyas Iyer shouts angrily at Venkatesh Iyer for refusing double, video goes viral
138.article_body: A video of KKR captain Shreyas Iyer shouting angrily at Venkatesh Iyer for refusing to run a double on the last ball of their 16th over against RR has gone viral. Shreyas was also seen staring at Venkatesh. Venkatesh got stumped out on the first delivery of the 17th over bowled by Yuzvendra Chahal.

139.title: RR's Prasidh Krishna and KKR's Aaron Finch involved in verbal fight, video goes viral
139.article_body: RR pacer Prasidh Krishna and KKR opener Aaron Finch were involved in a verbal exchange after the latter got out in their IPL 2022 match on Monday. Krishna was seen giving Finch a send-off after which the Australian said something to him. Finch was dismissed for 58(28) on last ball of KKR's ninth over. Krishna registered bowling figures of 4-0-43-1.

140.title: PM Modi to inaugurate India's 1st Semicon Conference on April 29 in B'luru
140.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first 'Semicon India 2022 Conference' in Bengaluru on April 29. The three-day event will be organised around the theme - Design and Manufacture in India for the World: Making India a "Semiconductor Nation". According to MoS (Electronics and IT) Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the government is looking forward to sign several MoUs during the event.

141.title: India records 1,247 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death; active cases at 11,860
141.article_body: India has reported 1,247 new COVID-19 cases and one death in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country saw 2,183 cases and 214 deaths. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,860, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,966.

142.title: Maybe we missed something in script: Prabhas on Radhe Shyam's performance
142.article_body: Prabhas, speaking about the underwhelming performance of his latest film 'Radhe Shyam' at the box office, said, "Maybe COVID or maybe we missed something in script." "Maybe people don't want to watch me in that zone, even if they want to watch - maybe they expect me to be too good," said Prabhas, who played a palmist in 'Radhe Shyam'.

143.title: Wore loose clothes to hide baby bump; now I'm open about it: Sonam on pregnancy
143.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor revealed that she tried to hide her baby bump at the beginning of her pregnancy. "I was trying to hide it because it was like a situation where I am still." "Now I am...being more open about it, but first I was trying to hide it, so I was wearing all these loose clothes," she added.

144.title: Talks with Putin stalled over mass killings in Ukraine: Macron
144.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said that his talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the Ukraine war have stalled. "Since the massacres we have discovered in Bucha and in other towns, the war has taken a different turn, so I did not speak to him again directly since, but I don't rule out doing so in the future", Macron said.

145.title: 11 held after stone-pelting incident on Hanuman Jayanti in Uttarakhand's Haridwar
145.article_body: Police on Monday booked 13 people and arrested 11 in connection with an alleged stone-pelting incident in Bhagwanpur area of Uttarakhand's Haridwar during a Hanuman Jayanti procession. The incident allegedly occurred when the procession was crossing a Muslim-dominated stretch in Danda Jalalpur village, police said. "Sufficient force is present in the village...situation is peaceful," police added.

146.title: Biggest risk of cryptocurrency will be money laundering, terror financing: Sitharaman
146.article_body: The biggest risk of cryptocurrency would be money laundering and its use for financing terror, said Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "I think regulation using technology is the only answer. Regulation using technology will have to be so adept, that it has to be not behind the curve, but be sure that it is on the top of it," she added.

147.title: Adheera is a bigger character: Sanjay on comparison between Adheera & Kancha
147.article_body: Sanjay Dutt spoke about his character 'Adheera' which has been compared with his portrayal of 'Kancha Cheena' in the 2012 film 'Agneepath', also starring actors Hrithik Roshan and Priyanka Chopra. He said, "The motive is...same. 'Kancha' wanted 'Mandwa', 'Adheera' wants 'KGF'. But the character, look and feel are different." "Adheera is a bigger character in his own right," he added.

148.title: Woman consumes poison outside venue of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's event
148.article_body: A woman on Monday allegedly consumed a poisonous substance outside the venue where Bihar CM Nitish Kumar holds 'Janta Darbar' programme, a police officer said. According to Patna SSP Manavjit Singh Dhillon, the woman is facing some marital problems and her husband is in jail. She was taken to a hospital and is now out of danger, police added.

149.title: Delhi court asks ASI not to remove Ganesha idols from Qutub complex
149.article_body: A Delhi court has directed the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) not to remove two Lord Ganesha idols called 'Ulta Ganesh' and 'Ganesha in cage', from the Qutub Minar complex till further directions. Last month, National Monuments Authority wrote a letter to ASI stating that the Ganesha idols should either be removed or given a "respectable" place in Qutub complex.

150.title: Felt wrong about being in dad's film, told him 'I cannot do this': Vivek Oberoi
150.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi said that it felt wrong for him to be a part of the film that his father Suresh Oberoi offered him. "My father didn't come with a sifaarish ki chitthi. He came to this incredibly difficult industry with his own merit...So, I took this critical decision and told him I cannot do this [the film]," Vivek said.

151.title: NamasteyNFT to host Web3-based exhibition event in Bengaluru
151.article_body: NamasteyNFT, a group that claims to support artists and creators, will host a two-day event to be held at Bangalore International Exhibition Centre from May 14 to 15. "The event will witness a confluence of artists, developers and collectors from Web3," said NamasteyNFT spokesperson. The event is expected to have workshops on Web3, cyber security and wallet safety.

152.title: Pakistan startup Abhi raises funds at $90 million valuation
152.article_body: Pakistani financial platform Abhi has raised $17 million in a Series A funding round led by Speedinvest at a valuation of $90 million. Global Ventures, VentureSouq, VEF, Sturgeon Capital, Rallycap, FJ Labs, Fatima Gobi, Sarmayacar and i2i Ventures also participated in the funding round. Pakistani startups raised over $350 million last year.

153.title: Cannabis worth ₹2.33 cr seized from truck in Andhra’s Anakapalle
153.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 1169.3 kg of cannabis worth about ₹2.33 crore from Andhra Pradesh’s Anakapalle district. A substantial quantity of cannabis was being transported via a truck from Anakapalle towards Hyderabad via Vijayawada, as per DRI's press release. "DRI found the truck in an accident-met and abandoned condition in a trench," the release stated.

154.title: Restoration work of Pune's Shivaji Market likely to begin in May
154.article_body: The restoration work of the Chhatrapati Shivaji Market in Pune is likely to begin in the third week of May. The renovation of the market, which comes under the Pune Cantonment Board, was delayed due to a lack of funds at the board. Notably, the reconstruction was necessitated due to the fire breaking out in the market in March 2021.

155.title: UP govt mandates prior permission for taking out religious processions
155.article_body: Following incidents of communal violence across the country during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti, the Uttar Pradesh government has mandated prior permission for taking out religious processions across the state. CM Yogi Adityanath said organisers have to produce an affidavit ensuring peace and harmony before seeking permission. "Permission shouldn't be given to any new processions," he added.

156.title: Zepto starts 10-min snacks delivery in Mumbai, CEO clarifies 'Not delivering food'
156.article_body: Zepto has started a 10-minute delivery of snacks in Mumbai. It has collaborated with restaurants such as Blue Tokai Coffee and Chaayos for the delivery of items like tea, coffee, and croissants, among others. Meanwhile, Aadit Palicha, CEO of Zepto clarified that they are not delivering food but only ready-to-drink coffee, tea, and packaged snacks.

157.title: Delhi sees most heatwave days in April since 2010, max temp at 41.6°C
157.article_body: Delhi on Monday recorded the seventh heatwave day so far in April 2022 and the highest for the month since 2010. Safdarjung observatory on Monday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, five degrees above normal. The national capital is likely to witness the eighth heatwave day on Tuesday, as per IMD. Notably, Delhi witnessed 11 heatwave days in April 2010.

158.title: Wanted to give him option against spin: McCullum on Venkatesh batting at no. 6
158.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said they wanted to give all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer, who opened their batting in all earlier games, an option against the spin and that's why he was moved to number six against RR on Monday. "We thought that Narine and Finch at the top was a very good opportunity," added McCullum. KKR lost by seven runs.

159.title: Assam's Kamrup district gets its first transgender tea stall
159.article_body: Assam's first transgender tea stall was inaugurated in the Kamrup district on Monday. All Assam Transgender Association has set up the stall in collaboration with the district administration. "This tea stall aims to empower the trans community of Assam and help them learn entrepreneurial as well as business communication skills," said Swati Bidhan Baruah, founder of the transgender association.

160.title: Flight door opens mid-air in Brazil, passengers hold it shut for 20 mins
160.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online that showed the moment when the door of a plane flung open mid-air in Brazil. While the door’s handrail hit the engine’s propeller, passengers reportedly held the door closed for 20 minutes until the plane landed safely. The plane was an Embraer 110 Bandeirante, which can fly between 15 and 21 passengers.

161.title: Salman and me were cordial & nice but I was never really close to him: Bhumika
161.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla, who was seen alongside actor Salman Khan in 'Tere Naam', said that the two were cordial and nice but she was never really close to the actor. She also said that she did not have "that much" interaction with him on a personal front. "I don't think I could get influenced by him," she added.

162.title: Hyderabad police arrest 7 people, seize 190 kg of ganja
162.article_body: Hyderabad's Meerpet police have arrested seven people for allegedly smuggling drugs and seized 190 kg of ganja from their possession, the police said on Monday. The prime accused had also been previously jailed for transporting drugs, the police added. The arrest was made after police intercepted a car, carrying 64 packets of ganja, during checking, the police further said.

163.title: I'm very different from my dad, don't expect my son to be like me: Shahid
163.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he is different from his father actor Pankaj Kapur. "I'm a different type of father...you understand what being a father means...It helps you have...better understanding of your parents...I don't expect my son to be like me...You have to choose what kind of a father you want to be," he added.

164.title: Robbers throw chilli powder, loot ₹1 crore from cash van at gunpoint in Gurugram
164.article_body: Around four-five armed robbers looted ₹1 crore from a van of a cash-collection company in Gurugram's Subhash Chowk area in broad daylight, said police. The accused allegedly threw chilli powder on the eyes of the guard and the van's driver and held them hostage at gunpoint. The guard told police that they had collected the money from 10 business establishments.

165.title: Israel strikes Gaza after rocket attack amid Jerusalem tensions
165.article_body: Israel on Tuesday carried out its first airstrikes on the Gaza Strip since January in response to a rocket fired from the Palestinian enclave amid Jerusalem tensions. The Israeli military said its aircraft attacked a "Hamas weapon manufacturing site". At least 152 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa Mosque compound on Friday.

166.title: Bengaluru Police bust cryptocurrency scam; 4 arrested
166.article_body: Four people were reportedly arrested by Bengaluru Police in connection with a cryptocurrency ponzi scam on Monday. The accused were running the operation through a mobile app called ShareHash, said Kamal Pant, Commissioner of Police. "The app promised high returns on investments and collected crores of rupees from gullible people," he added.

167.title: Govt to continue 15-day fare limit on air travel: Civil Aviation Minister Scindia
167.article_body: The Ministry of Civil Aviation imposed a fare cap for 15 days on air travel due to the pandemic. Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday said, "If we talk about the fare caps, then it is my responsibility to the passengers as well as to the airlines...The decision to remove it will be taken at an appropriate time."

168.title: Video of KKR captain Shreyas Iyer arguing with head coach Brendon McCullum goes viral
168.article_body: A video of Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Shreyas Iyer arguing with head coach Brendon McCullum after his dismissal against Rajasthan Royals (RR) has gone viral on social media. Iyer reportedly got angry over KKR's batting order during their run chase. RR won the match by seven runs. Iyer top-scored for KKR with 85(51).

169.title: Chahal recreates his World Cup meme pose to celebrate hat-trick, pic goes viral
169.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal recreated his 2019 World Cup 'relaxing' meme pose after taking a hat-trick and a five-wicket haul against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in their IPL 2022 match. Chahal registered bowling figures of 4-0-40-5 as RR defeated KKR by seven runs. Chahal is currently the leading wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with 17 wickets in six matches.

170.title: 61-year-old man dies while fighting off phone snatchers in Mumbai
170.article_body: A 61-year-old man died after he fell and hit his head while fighting off robbers, who allegedly snatched his phone and assaulted him, in Mumbai's Malad West. The incident took place when the victim was walking back home after grocery shopping. The man reportedly died after making a call to his wife and informing her about the incident.

171.title: Pakistan cutting power supply to houses, industry amid fuel shortage
171.article_body: Pakistan is cutting electricity supply to households and industry as it's not able to afford buying coal or natural gas from overseas. A report said Pakistan's energy costs more than doubled in nine months ending February from last year. Former finance minister Miftah Ismail also shared a post detailing how much power had been cut due to fuel shortages.

172.title: Delhi HC seeks report from authorities on electric, CNG crematoriums
172.article_body: The Delhi High Court asked the local authorities to file a report in four weeks on number of electric and CNG crematoriums in the city and the steps taken to promote them instead of the wood pyres. The High Court bench gave the order while hearing petitions concerning burial and cremation of dead bodies amid the COVID-19 outbreak last year.

173.title: Apollo Global Management interested in a Twitter deal: Report
173.article_body: Private equity firm Apollo Global Management has expressed interest in participating in a deal for Twitter, Reuters reported citing sources. Apollo is seeking ways it can provide financing to any deal and is open to working with Musk or any other bidder. Earlier, Thoma Bravo had expressed interest in a buyout after Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced his bid.

174.title: 19-year-old killed in hit-and-run case in Pune, 1 arrested
174.article_body: A 19-year-old youth was killed in a hit-and-run case in Pune's Katraj and a truck driver has been arrested, police said. "There is parking at the back of the police station. But that space was booked for some party so he was taking the truck to the substitute location when he hit this person...ran over his head," police added.

175.title: The 2nd phase of war has started: Ukraine
175.article_body: As Russia launched a new offensive in the east of the country, Ukraine said that the second phase of war has started.
