Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that a "very large part of the entire Russian army is now focused on this offensive." "No matter how many Russian troops they send there, we will fight," he added.

176.title: Duo talks about bid to loot 3rd temple near Pune bus stop; caught
176.article_body: Pune police arrested two people, aged 25 and 19, on Monday for alleged jewellery thefts at two temples in the city. The duo was caught while they were discussing their bid to loot a third temple near a bus stop in Warje Malwadi. Following the arrest, police recovered stolen jewellery and funds, worth a total of ₹18,234 from the duo.

177.title: 4-yr-old run over by school bus while being dropped off in Gurugram
177.article_body: A four-year-old boy died after he was allegedly run over by his school minibus while being dropped off in Gurugram, police said. "After he got off the bus, the driver drove the vehicle away...boy came under it," police added. "It appears he came under the tyres...He suffered several injuries on his stomach, arms and legs," the deceased's father said.

178.title: Female TikTok star jailed for 3 years for exploiting girls for money in Egypt
178.article_body: Female Egyptian TikTok star Haneen Hossam has been sentenced to three years in prison after being accused of exploiting girls for money through video-sharing platforms. Hossam was convicted of human trafficking over an invitation to her followers to get paid for making live videos. Human rights activists said she has been prosecuted as part of a crackdown on female influencers.

179.title: Police share picture of oldest Mumbai police station, say its 162 yrs old
179.article_body: Mumbai Police took to Twitter to share the picture of Pydhonie, the oldest police station in Mumbai. "With its stone facade and iron railing arch balconies on every floor, this 162-year-old police station has indeed bore witness to history," police wrote on Twitter. Pictures of other police stations along with their establishment details were also shared.

180.title: Cristiano Ronaldo announces death of his newborn son, asks for privacy
180.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo announced that one of his newborn twins has passed away. Ronaldo, who was expecting twins with girlfriend Georgina Rodriguez, revealed she has given birth to a girl, while their son died. "It's the greatest pain that any parents can feel...We're all devastated at this loss and we kindly ask for privacy at this very difficult time," he wrote.

181.title: Brochara 2 premieres exclusively on Voot on 18 April 2022
181.article_body: Voot's new show Brochara 2 captures the bromance between four friends, Abhimanyu, Kanan, Shivashish and Pranay as they navigate life, ambitions, and relationships together with each other's unhindered support. The 5-episodic series boasts of Ankur Rathee, Amey Wagh, Varun Tewari, and Sayandeep Sengupta in the lead roles. Viewers can now watch the show for free on Voot.

182.title: Rajasthan Royals defeat Kolkata Knight Riders in 427-run thriller
182.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) defeated Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) by seven runs in their IPL 2022 match on Monday to jump to the second position on the points table. RR put up a total of 217/5 with Jos Buttler scoring 103(61). KKR were bowled out for 210 in 19.4 overs. RR's Yuzvendra Chahal recorded figures of 4-0-40-5, including a hat-trick.

183.title: RR's Yuzvendra Chahal takes his first hat-trick in IPL
183.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal on Monday took his first hat-trick in IPL against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). The 31-year-old dismissed KKR's Shreyas Iyer, Shivam Mavi and Pat Cummins in consecutive deliveries of his last over. Chahal recorded bowling figures of 4-0-40-5, his first five-wicket haul in IPL.

184.title: 12-yr-old student run over by bus in Punjab's Sangrur, 3 injured
184.article_body: A 12-year-old government school student was killed in Punjab's Sangrur while three others suffered serious injuries after a Pepsu Road Transport Corporation bus hit them on Monday. "It seems that the bus was at a high speed when it rammed into the schoolchildren," police said. The injured were taken to a civil hospital where they are undergoing treatment.

185.title: He's the punisher: Irfan after Buttler's 2nd ton in IPL 2022
185.article_body: After opener Jos Buttler hit his second century for RR against KKR at Brabourne Stadium on Monday in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter and wrote, "He [Buttler] is the punisher." Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Different league Buttler boss." Praising Buttler, Michael Vaughan said, "Best T20 player in the world." Buttler scored 103 runs in 61 balls.

186.title: Those who do 'puja' can't create disturbance: Nitish on clashes
186.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, while speaking about clashes that took place in some states during Hanuman Jayanti, said, "How could a person who wants to do puja...create...communal disturbance." He added that fringe elements are the ones who are involved in creating disharmony. He further said there wasn't any incident in Bihar as he "doesn't give any space for communal disturbance".

187.title: Sri Lanka may overcome economic crisis if govt, people cooperate: Ex-PM
187.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Monday that the country's ongoing economic crisis can be solved if both the government and citizens accept a uniform solution. He added that the anti-government protesters have created a situation of political instability in the country. Notably, Sri Lanka announced 17 new ministerial appointments today, weeks after 26 ministers resigned from Cabinet.

188.title: Big B confirms grandson Agastya Nanda's debut in 'The Archies'
188.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan on Monday confirmed his grandson Agastya Nanda's Bollywood debut with Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies' by sharing a fan-made collage. He wrote on Twitter, "A new chapter begins in your life and there cannot be greater joy among us all. My blessings my love...Do well. AND keep the flag flying." Suhana Khan and Khushi Kapoor co-star in the film.

189.title: Denial of sex not 'exceptional hardship' to end marriage before 1-yr period: HC
189.article_body: Denial of sex is tantamount to "cruelty" but not "exceptional hardship", the Delhi High Court has said. It, hence, cannot be grounds for dissolution of marriage before the mandated cooling-off period of one year in a divorce case, it added. It said this while refusing to set aside a trial court order dismissing a mutual divorce petition of a couple.

190.title: Now my kids are old enough: Aishwaryaa on returning to work after 7yrs
190.article_body: Director Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth, who will be making her comeback after seven years, has said that she had taken a break to spend more time with her sons. She added that she got several offers to direct Hindi films but she wasn't in the mindset to work. "It feels great to be back. Now my children are old enough," Aishwaryaa said.

191.title: Post-Nadal stage will be difficult for Spanish tennis: Ferrer
191.article_body: Ex-world number three David Ferrer said it'll be a "difficult stage" for Spanish tennis after 35-year-old Rafael Nadal's retirement from the sport, adding the 21-time Grand Slam champion's shadow covers a lot. "There'll be no other player like him [Nadal]. But we're lucky. We've Carlos Alcaraz who is going to be a benchmark for Spanish tennis," he added.

192.title: Vande Bharat Express trains to run between Khajuraho and Delhi
192.article_body: The Vande Bharat Express train will operate between Khajuraho and Delhi soon, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has announced. He said, "Two rake points have been approved at Chhatarpur and Khajuraho. Rail tickets can now be obtained from 45,000 post offices". Vaishnaw, who was on a visit to Khajuraho, further said that after redevelopment, Khajuraho will become a world-class station.

193.title: Putin discusses Ukraine crisis with Palestinian President Abbas
193.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin held a phone call with his Palestinian counterpart Mahmoud Abbas and discussed the ongoing conflict in Ukraine, Kremlin said on Monday. The two leaders also discussed escalating tensions in West Bank and East Jerusalem, Kremlin added. At least 152 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound on Friday.

194.title: US to train Ukrainians to use Howitzers in coming days: Official
194.article_body: The US military plans to start training Ukrainian trainers on using the Howitzer artillery system in the coming days, a senior US official said on Monday. The training would take place outside Ukraine, the official added. The US and its allies have provided military aid to the Ukrainian military to help it fight Russian forces invading the country.

195.title: Wear masks in crowded places: Chandigarh govt amid COVID-19 rise
195.article_body: The Chandigarh Health Department on Monday issued an advisory asking people to wear face masks in crowded places in the wake of rising COVID-19 cases in some states and Union Territories. It said wearing of face masks is need to be especially ensured in closed environments like public transport. Masks should be used in classrooms and indoor gatherings, it added.

196.title: Johnny, Amber engaged in 'mutual abuse': Former marriage counsellor
196.article_body: In the defamation case filed by Johnny Depp against ex-wife Amber Heard, their former marriage counsellor has stated that they engaged in "mutual abuse". She added they were both domestically abused during childhood. "If Depp was [leaving] to de-escalate the fight, she'd hit him to keep him there...she'd rather be in a fight than have him leave," their counsellor said.

197.title: Mariupol is still contested between Russia & Ukraine: US official
197.article_body: The besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol is still contested between Russian and Ukrainian forces, a senior US official said. The city remains under threat from Russian missile and artillery strikes, the official added. There are roughly 76 Russian battalion tactical groups in southern and eastern Ukraine, an increase of about 11 in recent days, the official further said.

198.title: 89 convicted of lynching Lankan man & burning his body in Pak, 6 sentenced to die
198.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan on Monday convicted 89 people for lynching Sri Lankan man Priyantha Kumara and burning his body in December 2021. Six of the accused have been sentenced to death and seven were given life imprisonment in the case. A mob of over 800 people had attacked a garment factory and killed the 47-year-old over blasphemy allegations.

199.title: Duty to shut anything causing problems in a secular state: Assam CM
199.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Monday said it's a duty to shut anything irritating students or other communities in a secular state. "If there's a genuine demand around exams (to not play loudspeakers), don't play it," Sarma said. He also expressed concerns regarding several attempts made by fundamentalists to create a base in Assam with the help of sympathisers.

200.title: Biggest challenge in 'Jersey' was learning to play cricket at 39: Shahid
200.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, on being asked about the biggest challenge playing a cricketer in upcoming film 'Jersey', said that it was learning to play cricket at the age of 39. He further said that he went through a lot of injuries. "I thought it'll be easy but I went through a very tough time learning the sport," the actor added.

201.title: KRK announces 'Deshdrohi 2', says it'll be bigger than 'Baahubali'
201.article_body: Actor-critic Kamaal R Khan on Monday announced his next film 'Deshdrohi 2' and shared its poster on Twitter which reads "bigger than 'Baahubali'". Kamaal tweeted that shooting for the film will begin soon. A social media user replied to the poster, "The movie nobody asked for and nobody needs," while another wrote, "India is not ready for another pandemic."

202.title: If I don't use a plane, I have less hours to work: World's richest man Musk
202.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk has said that he does not spend "billions of dollars a year" in personal consumption. Stating that his personal consumption is not high, Musk said in a TED interview, "The one exception is a plane, but if I don't use the plane, then I have less hours to work." He added, "I don't...really take vacations."

203.title: Ready to review executive powers, says Sri Lanka's Prez amid crisis
203.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said that he's open to changes in the nation's constitution, potentially setting the stage for curbing the executive powers of his office. Rajapaksa's comment is an attempt to appease protesters calling for his ouster amid a severe economic crisis in the country, a report said. He appointed 17 new Cabinet ministers today.

204.title: No bhajan on loudspeakers near mosques around azaan call in Nashik
204.article_body: Nashik Police Commissioner Deepak Pandey on Monday issued a directive stating that no one will be allowed to play bhajan or other songs on loudspeaker 15 minutes before and after the call of azaan. This is applicable for areas within a 100-metre radius of any mosque. Pandey issued another directive instructing religious places to take prior permission for loudspeaker usage.

205.title: South Korea removes most COVID-19 restrictions as virus cases drop
205.article_body: South Korea has lifted most of its COVID-19 restrictions as new coronavirus cases dropped to 47,743 on Monday, the country's lowest daily tally in over two months. A midnight curfew on restaurants and other businesses has been removed, along with a limit of 10 people allowed to gather. People are, however, still required to wear masks outdoors.

206.title: Lalchand picks Jadeja and 4 other spinners for India's 2022 T20 WC squad
206.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has picked all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, Washington Sundar, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravi Bishnoi as spin bowlers who can be a part of Team India's squad for 2022 T20 World Cup in Australia. All five are currently playing for their respective teams in IPL 2022. The World Cup will begin on October 16.

207.title: Prashant Kishor meets Sonia, other top Cong leaders for 2nd time in 3 days
207.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor met Congress chief Sonia Gandhi at her residence at 10 Janpath in Delhi on Monday. This is their second meeting at Sonia's residence in the last 3 days. The meeting comes amid reports of Kishor joining Congress ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Congress leaders Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and P Chidambaram were also present.

208.title: 1984 a dark chapter in Indian history: Vivek Agnihotri on 'The Delhi Files'
208.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'The Delhi Files', filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri stated that the year 1984 is a dark chapter in Indian history. He further said the way the Punjab terrorism situation was handled was inhuman, adding that it was purely for vote bank politics. "To date there has been no justice, what can be worse than that," Vivek said.

209.title: Delhi Capitals' Mitchell Marsh admitted to hospital after testing COVID-19 positive
209.article_body: Delhi Capitals all-rounder Mitchell Marsh has been admitted to hospital after testing COVID-19 positive, the IPL franchise said in a statement. "A few more members from the Delhi Capitals bio-bubble, including support staff members, have returned positive tests as well. Though they are all asymptomatic, their condition is being monitored closely by the franchise," the statement further read.

210.title: Russian missile strikes kill 7 in Ukraine's Lviv: Officials
210.article_body: At least seven people were killed and 11 others were injured in Russian missile strikes on Ukraine's Lviv, local authorities said on Monday. The youngest victim among the seven killed was aged 30, the Mayor of Lviv said. Notably, Lviv has become a major centre for NATO-supplied weapons and foreign fighters joining the Ukrainian side in the conflict.

211.title: Set an example so incidents like Jahangirpuri aren't repeated: Shah to Police
211.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday directed Delhi Police officials to take strict action against perpetrators of the Jahangirpuri violence. The action should be such that it sets a precedent so that such incidents are not repeated, Shah told the police officials. Over 20 people have been arrested in connection to the incident that took place on Saturday.

212.title: Whenever I, Ashwin are in nets we discuss last and next games: RR's Chahal
212.article_body: Speaking about the planning he does with his teammate Ravichandran Ashwin for the matches in ongoing IPL, RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said when they are practising in nets they both talk about previous and next matches. He added that they watch videos together and discuss which delivery to bowl to which batter. Chahal is leading wicket-taker in the tournament currently.

213.title: FIR filed against Jahangirpuri rally organisers for not taking permission
213.article_body: An FIR has been registered against the members of the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal for taking out a Hanuman Jayanti rally without permission in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where violence was reported. "One accused person has joined the investigation," DCP (North West) Usha Rangnani said. The other two processions in Jahangirpuri area had due permission.

214.title: Yami Gautam was the first and only choice for 'Dasvi': Director
214.article_body: 'Dasvi' director Tushar Jalota in an interview has revealed that actress Yami Gautam was the first and only choice for policewoman Jyoti Daiswal. Tushar said that Jyoti is razor-focused, cutting sharp and has a steely authority. "When we were casting for this role in 'Dasvi', I couldn't imagine anyone else other than Yami Gautam playing Jyoti Daiswal," he added.

215.title: RR record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far
215.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) put up a total of 217/5 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Monday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far. This is Royals' second 200-plus total in IPL 2022. The previous highest total in IPL 2022 was 216/4, registered by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on April 12.

216.title: Adani Green Energy overtakes SBI as India's 7th most valuable company
216.article_body: Adani Green Energy overtook the State Bank of India (SBI) on Monday to become the country's seventh most valuable company. The company's shares have surged over 120% year-to-date and its market valuation currently stands at ₹4.64 lakh crore. Adani Green is the only non-Sensex company featuring in the list of top 10 companies on BSE in terms of market capitalisation.

217.title: Cong's 3-day 'Chintan Shivir' likely to be held in Raj from May 14
217.article_body: Congress' three-day 'Chintan Shivir' is likely to be held in Rajasthan's Jaipur from May 14 onwards, sources said on Monday. Around 400 party leaders are expected to gather at meeting, which will focus on party's poll results in recently-held Assembly elections in five states. Notably, Rahul Gandhi was made party's Vice-President at Congress' last 'Chintan Shivir' in Jaipur in 2013.

218.title: Masks made mandatory in 4 Haryana districts as Gurugram sees 198 COVID-19 cases
218.article_body: The Haryana government on Monday made face masks mandatory in Gurugram, Faridabad, Sonipat and Jhajjar districts of the National Capital Region. This came amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in Gurugram which reported 198 fresh cases on Monday. Uttar Pradesh had earlier today made the wearing of face masks mandatory in Lucknow and six NCR districts.

219.title: I feel more content with the scripts I'm offered in South: Hansika
219.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani said that she is more content with the scripts offered to her in South Indian films. "I enjoy doing all kinds of cinema, but I get more roles offered here," she added. However, she stated that being an entertainer, she'll entertain in any language if she gets a chance. "I have never put barricades around," she stated.

220.title: 'Coolie No. 1' actor Rajat Rawail hospitalised over varicose vein rupture
220.article_body: Varun Dhawan-starrer 2020 film 'Coolie No. 1' actor Rajat Rawail has been hospitalised following excessive loss of blood due to a rupture of a varicose vein in his right leg. Rajat was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai over the weekend, reported ETimes. The actor said that he has been advised total bed rest with no visitors.

221.title: Second Global COVID-19 Summit scheduled for May 12: US
221.article_body: The second Global COVID-19 Summit will be held on May 12 to discuss efforts to end the pandemic and prepare for future health threats, the US has announced. The virtual gathering will be co-chaired by the US, along with G7, G20, African Union and CARICOM, a Caribbean grouping. "Together, we can mitigate the impact of COVID-19," a joint statement said.

222.title: Delhi sees over 500 new COVID cases for 2nd straight day, positivity rate at 7.7%
222.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 501 fresh cases of COVID-19 for the second straight day, after seeing 517 cases on Sunday. The daily positivity rate in the national capital was 7.72% on Monday as compared to 4.21% on Sunday, while no related deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours. The city now has 1,729 active COVID-19 cases.

223.title: Before 'Gangubai...' I'd be replaced at the last minute: Shantanu
223.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari, who made his Bollywood debut in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', recalled his struggling days and said he would get rejected or replaced at the last minute in films. "I am glad those projects didn't happen because then 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' wouldn't have happened, I wouldn't have gotten a chance to work with Sanjay sir," he further stated.

224.title: Colourful seadragons wash up on Australian beaches after record rainfall
224.article_body: Dozens of colourful sea creatures have washed up on various Australian beaches following weeks of record rainfall. Pictures of the seadragons stranded on the beaches of Cronulla, Malabar and the Central Coast have been shared online. Experts say that the number of seadragons seen on beaches has been ten times the normal amount during the recent weeks.

225.title: Jos Buttler smashes his second hundred of IPL 2022
225.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler smashed his second hundred of IPL 2022 after reaching the three-figure mark off 59 deliveries against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Monday. Overall, it was Buttler's third IPL hundred for RR. He is the third cricketer after Virat Kohli and Chris Gayle to smash at least three hundreds for one franchise.

226.title: Calm character for someone who hasn't played a lot: Hesson on RCB's Shahbaz
226.article_body: RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said all-rounder Shahbaz Ahamad is a calming influence in the team. "We know he's got power, so at...back end, he chooses the right time to do it. He's a...calm character for someone who hasn't played too many games," he added. Shahbaz has scored 145 runs in four innings in IPL 2022 so far.

227.title: Barrage of Western sanctions against Russia failed: Prez Putin
227.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday claimed that the barrage of Western sanctions against Russia has failed. The West "expected to quickly upset the financial-economic situation, provoke panic in the markets, the collapse of the banking system and shortages in stores", he said. He also claimed that the sanctions have backfired on the West with a sharp rise in inflation.

228.title: Cyprus eases COVID-19 entry requirements for vaccinated arrivals
228.article_body: Cyprus on Monday announced that vaccinated arrivals won't have to undergo COVID-19 testing prior to boarding a flight or on arrival. Additionally, all Cyprus-bound passengers will no longer be required to fill out a travel form, also known as 'Cyprus Flight Pass'. Unvaccinated arrivals will, however, need to undergo either an RT-PCR or rapid antigen test prior to arrival.

229.title: Integrated command-control centre in all smart cities by Aug 15: Puri
229.article_body: Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Monday said 80 out of 100 Smart Cities in India have Integrated Command and Control Centres and the remaining cities will get it by August 15. "Work has started in almost all government-funded projects [under] the Smart Cities Mission (SCM) and [the] projects...will be completed by next year," Puri added.

230.title: Twitter board members' salary will be $0 if I acquire the company: Musk
230.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said on Monday that Twitter's board of directors will not receive any compensation if he succeeds in acquiring the company. "Board salary will be $0 if my bid succeeds, so that's ~$3 million/year saved right there," he tweeted. Twitter currently spends about $2.9 million in cash and stock awards to board members, as per filings.

231.title: Who is India's new Army chief Lieutenant General Manoj Pande?
231.article_body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande will take charge as the 29th chief of the Army Staff in India. An alumnus of the National Defence Academy, Khadakwasla and the Indian Military Academy, Dehradun, Pande has a military career spanning nearly 40 years. He has commanded an engineer brigade along the LoC in J&K during Operation Parakram (during the 2001-2002 India-Pakistan standoff).

232.title: Anil forced Boney to give me hike in 'Woh 7 Din': Satish Kaushik
232.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik has revealed that actor Anil Kapoor forced his brother producer Boney Kapoor to give him ₹501 from his earlier decided fee of ₹201 in 1983 film 'Woh 7 Din'. "The first day of shoot I had to wear a shirt. Anil brought one and said...Rishi Kapoor had worn it in 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan'," he added.

233.title: Lifetime chance for youngsters: Anand on 100-day countdown to Chess Olympiad
233.article_body: Marking the 100-day countdown for 44th Chess Olympiad, to be held in Chennai, on Monday, five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said the tournament is a life-time opportunity for youngsters to catch a glimpse of their idols. "Watch them play and possibly interact with them," he added. The Olympiad will be held from July 28 to August 10.

234.title: Sayani Gupta, Tamannaah wear same saree at Iftaar party, share pics
234.article_body: Actresses Sayani Gupta and Tamannaah Bhatia on Sunday turned up in the same saree designed by Monica Shah and Karishma Swali's brand Jade at Baba Siddiqui's Iftaar party. Sayani took to Instagram Stories to share pictures with Tamannaah, writing, "Tamannaah and I were twinning. Thanks @jady_bymk for giving us the same outfits. Had to take photos."

235.title: It started in my 30s: Jennifer Aniston on battling insomnia
235.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston has revealed that she battles with insomnia and said that it started in her 30s. "I dread spending another night counting cracks in the walls...And the more I worry about it [sleeping]...harder it is to fall asleep," she told the People magazine. Jennifer further said she used to sleepwalk, however, added she doesn't do it anymore.

236.title: Rise in private debt due to COVID-19 may affect growth over 3 yrs: IMF
236.article_body: A chapter of the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook said debt accumulated by the private sector during the COVID-19 pandemic could lower growth for emerging markets by 1.3% over three years. For developed nations, growth is expected to be reduced by 0.9%. IMF had earlier forecasted advanced and emerging markets to grow at 3.9% and 4.8% in 2022.

237.title: Ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS: CEO
237.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan called the current scramble for employees "transitory" and argued that, ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS, Bloomberg reported. He said that TCS enjoys the highest structural margins. "We enjoy the benefit of occupying the high point on the profitability side...everybody else is benchmarked below us," he added.

238.title: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 3.2% due to Ukraine war
238.article_body: World Bank President David Malpass on Monday said the bank has cut its global growth forecast for 2022 from 4.1% to 3.2% owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. Forecasts are being cut for advanced and many developing economies because of spikes in food, energy prices, Malpass said. World Bank is also proposing a new, 15-month crisis financing target of $170 billion.

239.title: Railway police officer killed, another injured in terror attack in J&K
239.article_body: A Railway Protection Force Head Constable was killed and an Assistant Sub-Inspector injured after terrorists opened fire at them in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Monday, officials said. The incident took place near a tea stall in Kakapora area. After the attack, Head Constable Surinder Singh and ASI Devraj were taken to a hospital where Singh was declared dead.

240.title: 27-year-old Iñaki Williams goes 6 years without missing a La Liga match
240.article_body: Athletic Club forward Iñaki Williams has now gone six years without missing a La Liga match. The 27-year-old Spanish footballer achieved the feat after being named in starting XI for Sunday's La Liga match against Celta Vigo. He has now played 227 La Liga matches in a row. He holds the record for most consecutive appearances in La Liga.

241.title: I haven't replied to Congress' show-cause notice: Sunil Jakhar
241.article_body: Ex-Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar on Monday said he hasn't replied to the show-cause notice issued to him by the Congress disciplinary committee. The notice was issued on April 11 for going against "party line" and using "objectionable words" for the Dalit community. Jakhar has denied making any statement against the community saying his remarks were put "out of context".

242.title: Man with knife arrested after confronting police near UK PM's home
242.article_body: The UK Police on Monday said that they've arrested a 29-year-old man armed with a knife who confronted two Ministry of Defence police officers near British PM's official residence in London. The incident isn't being treated as terror-related, it added. "He was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder and...remains in custody at a central London police station," it further said.

243.title: Cycle theft accused dies in custody in Odisha, family alleges torture
243.article_body: A cycle theft accused from Odisha's Bhubaneswar, who died in police custody after being arrested on Sunday, was allegedly tortured, his family has claimed. The deceased's wife said she found her husband dead after being asked to come to the hospital late at night. "If...police nabbed my husband at 7.30 pm, why did they inform...at 1.30 am," his wife said.

244.title: Minor girl, man found hanging from tree in Punjab's Ferozepur
244.article_body: The bodies of a minor girl and a man were found hanging from a tree in a village in Punjab's Ferozepur on Monday. The bodies were first spotted at around 7.30 am by local residents who then informed the police. A motorcycle that was parked nearby has been impounded and the bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

245.title: Gold prices jump to 1-month high amid Russia-Ukraine war, inflation concerns
245.article_body: Gold prices jumped to more than one-month high on Monday amid concerns over economic fallout from Russia-Ukraine war and surging inflation. Spot gold rose 0.9% to $1,991.51 per ounce. Among other metals, spot silver rose 1% to $25.93 per ounce, whereas Platinum climbed 1.8%. Bullion is considered a safe store of value during times of political and economic crisis.

246.title: US official to visit Solomon Islands amid concerns over China pact
246.article_body: The White House on Monday said that US Indo-Pacific Coordinator Kurt Campbell will visit the Solomon Islands this week, amid concerns about the potential security pact between the island country and China. Earlier, Australia's Minister for the Pacific had visited the country to discuss the proposed security pact. The agreement would allow China to deploy its military in the region.

247.title: 2 captured Britons come on Russian state TV, ask to be swapped with Putin ally
247.article_body: Two British soldiers captured in Ukraine by Russian forces appeared on Russian state TV on Monday and asked to be exchanged for an ally of Vladimir Putin known as the 'Prince of darkness'. Shaun Pinner and Aiden Aslin appealed to UK PM Boris Johnson to negotiate their release in exchange for Viktor Medvedchuk, a Ukrainian politician who's close to Putin.

248.title: Maha govt must ban leaders' rallies who create communal tensions: Patole
248.article_body: Congress' Nana Patole said on Monday that the Maharashtra government must ban public rallies of political leaders who try to create communal tensions. Patole's remark comes a day after Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray announced that he'll conduct a rally in Aurangabad on May 1. Thackeray had earlier demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

249.title: Islamic body moves SC against bulldozing houses of riot accused
249.article_body: Islamic body Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has moved Supreme Court seeking appropriate direction to states against demolishing houses of accused in cases of violence. This comes after Madhya Pradesh government used bulldozers to raze down houses of persons accused of rioting during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone. The petitioner said resorting to such measures is clearly against constitutional ethos.

250.title: Nadal trains for first time in a month since Indian Wells final, shares pic
250.article_body: Twenty-one time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal took to Twitter to share a photo of himself training for the first time since losing in Indian Wells Masters last month. "Today after four weeks without stepping on a tennis court, first light training. What an illusion to step on the earth again!" he wrote. Nadal had injured his rib in semi-final.

251.title: I always found it tough to bowl to Sehwag in IPL: KKR spinner Narine
251.article_body: Ahead of his 150th IPL match, KKR spinner Sunil Narine was asked who he thinks played him the best in IPL, to which he replied Virender Sehwag. "I always found it tough because he was a guy who always kept the game going no matter what situation the team was in, he kept batting the way he did," he added.

252.title: Provide COVID-19 data daily: Centre as Kerala reports data after 5-day gap
252.article_body: Union Health Ministry has written a letter to Kerala Principal Secretary Rajan Khobragade, asking him to ensure updating COVID-19 data daily as the state reported its data after five days since April 13. ''Daily and diligent reporting of data is critical to arrive at a meaningful understanding of the pandemic in districts, state and national level," the ministry added.

253.title: Kangana is Brahmastra in reality show 'Lock Upp': Tusshar Kapoor
253.article_body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor has stated that ALT Balaji has launched a Brahmastra in the form of actress Kangana Ranaut as a host on reality show 'Lock Upp'. "She's the perfect person to host the show. Her frank attitude...courageous nature and the confidence with which she tells people their truth or judges them...is very fair and very real," the actor added.

254.title: KKR to bowl first against RR, RR make three changes to their playing XI
254.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. KKR have made one change to their playing XI, with Shivam Mavi replacing Aman Khan. RR have included Karun Nair, Obed McCoy and Trent Boult in their playing XI.

255.title: Previous govts left Punjab with a debt of ₹3 lakh crore: CM Mann
255.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday blamed state's previous governments for its debt. "Previous governments...left a debt of ₹3 lakh crore on Punjab. But where has this loan been used? We'll investigate and recover [the amount],” AAP's Punjab unit tweeted quoting Mann. Notably, Mann sought financial package of ₹1 lakh crore for state from PM Narendra Modi after assuming charge.

256.title: 8-yr-old boy found dead in Pune's Chikhali, murder probe launched
256.article_body: An 8-year-old boy was found dead with a "fatal injury inflicted with a blunt hard object" at a tin shed in Pune's Chikhali on Sunday, police said. His family had lodged a missing complaint when he didn't return home for a long time following which a search was launched. We've registered a murder case and launched a probe, police added.

257.title: Pressure is at its highest: Zaheer on MI's 6-match losing streak
257.article_body: MI Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said that the pressure level is "at its highest" for the team as they've lost six consecutive matches in ongoing IPL. "This is a team sport so we have to stick together, have to find ways of coming together and then become a force," he stated. It's MI's worst start in IPL history.

258.title: Don't remember last time I saw damsel in distress on screen: Avantika
258.article_body: Actress Avantika Dassani has stated that she doesn't remember the last time she saw a damsel in distress on the screen. "Everyone keeps asking me this question and I ask them the last time they saw it too," she added. The actress further said that she doesn't want to limit herself to anything, adding that all experiences are welcome.

259.title: Hardik has absolutely thrived in captaincy role for GT in IPL: Kirsten
259.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya for leading GT in IPL 2022, batting coach Gary Kirsten said Hardik is a class and has absolutely thrived in the new role of a captain. "He's a fantastic batter...can play in a lot of different ways...he's played with great maturity," Kirsten added. GT are currently on top of standings, winning five of six matches so far.

260.title: Turkey launches military operation against Kurdish militants in Iraq
260.article_body: Turkey on Monday announced the launch of a new ground and air cross-border military operation against Kurdish militants in northern Iraq. The jets successfully struck shelters, bunkers, caves, tunnels, ammunition depots and headquarters belonging to the militants, the Turkish Defence Minister said. At least 19 Kurdish militants were killed and about four Turkish soldiers were injured, he added.

261.title: Speculative in nature: Mindtree on report of $22 bn merger with L&T Infotech
261.article_body: Mindtree on Monday clarified that news reports of its merger with Larsen & Toubro Infotech are "speculative in nature". Mindtree said, "We would like to state that there is no information available with the company as of today." Bloomberg earlier reported that Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between the two software firms to create a $22 billion firm.

262.title: What is 'pyramid fraud' that Amway India is accused of running?
262.article_body: The ED accused Amway India of running a 'pyramid fraud' and provisionally attached its assets worth ₹757.77 crore. It alleged Amway of running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing network and exorbitant pricing of products. "Gullible public is induced to join as members and purchase products at exorbitant prices, losing their hard-earned money," ED said.

263.title: Fati was born to score goals, he reminds me of Samuel Eto'o: Alves
263.article_body: Barcelona player Dani Alves has said that forward Ansu Fati reminds him of former Barcelona forward Samuel Eto'o. "Fati was born to score goals...He is a machine for destroying defences. I think he can also define an era, a special history within Barcelona," Dani added. Fati donned the number 10 jersey after Lionel Messi's departure from the club.

264.title: Lt Gen Manoj Pande appointed Indian Army chief, 1st engineer to hold the post
264.article_body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande was on Monday appointed as the new chief of the Indian Army. He's the first engineer to hold the post. Pande, who was appointed Vice Chief of the Army Staff in February 2022, will succeed General MM Naravane as Army chief. A decision on the appointment of the Chief of Defence Staff is reportedly still pending.

265.title: Investors lose ₹2.5 lakh crore wealth in a day as Sensex crashes 1,170 points
265.article_body: Nearly ₹2.5 lakh crore was wiped off investors' wealth on Monday as Sensex plunged 1,172 points to settle at 57,166 amid weak global cues. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies dropped to ₹269.48 lakh crore from ₹ 272.12 lakh crore in the previous session. Infosys, HDFC, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra, Wipro and TCS were among the top losers on Monday.

266.title: Central Railway organises unique light & sound show at Mumbai's CSMT
266.article_body: Central Railway organised a unique light and sound show at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) heritage building on Sunday to commemorate entering 170th year of Indian Railways. The show was titled 'Navarasangam - ek gatha CSMT ki'. It also commemorated the World Heritage Day, Railway Week and Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav, a celebration of 75 years of India's independence.

267.title: Real Madrid's Benzema is exceptional: Man City manager Pep Guardiola
267.article_body: Ahead of the Champions League semifinal fixture against Real Madrid, Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema is exceptional. "Benzema is not only a scorer but is a fantastic all-round player. His career is phenomenal," Guardiola added. In the ongoing Champions League season, Benzema has scored 12 goals in nine games played so far.

268.title: Kejriwal to visit Bengaluru on April 21, attend farmers' convention
268.article_body:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will visit Bengaluru on April 21 and attend a convention of farmers on the invitation of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha chief and farmer leader Kodihalli Chandrashekhar. 
AAP's Karnataka Convener Prithvi Reddy said the party is the platform for people who fight for farmers' cause. He said AAP wants to get such people elected to Vidhana Soudha.

269.title: Govt registered highest-ever 1.67 lakh companies in FY22, up 8% YoY
269.article_body: Corporate Affairs Ministry registered over 1.67 lakh companies incorporations in FY22, an 8% YoY increase from 1.55 lakh companies incorporations registered in FY21. This is the highest number of company incorporations in a financial year till date. The Ministry said it has taken many initiatives for reducing the number of procedures, time and cost for starting a business in India.

270.title: Goa CM should withdraw comments on 'religious conversion': Cong leader
270.article_body: Congress' Michael Lobo reacted to Goa CM Pramod Sawant's comments on 'religious conversion', stating that Sawant should withdraw the "unwarranted" remarks. "[Sawant's] trying to polarise one section of the society...[he] needs to take everyone along," Lobo added. Sawant had said that Goa government will never allow religious conversions in the state, adding that people should be vigilant about it.

271.title: If philanthropy is love of humanity, my companies are philanthropy: Musk
271.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk said SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink and The Boring Company, the companies that he has founded, are philanthropy. "If you say philanthropy is love of humanity, they are philanthropy," Musk added. Asked about his views on billionaire philanthropy, he said, "If you care about reality of goodness instead of the perception of it, philanthropy is extremely difficult."

272.title: Noida parents protest school fee hike by polishing shoes
272.article_body: A group of parents in Greater Noida on Sunday polished shoes on the roadside as a symbolic gesture to protest against the hike in fees by private schools. The protest comes despite a UP government order that allowed the schools to hike their fees. The protestors have appealed to the CM to withdraw the order to make education more accessible.

273.title: Pics show final moments of Russian warship after being hit by Ukrainian missiles
273.article_body: Pictures and footage purportedly showing the final moments of the Russian warship Moskva that sank after being hit by two Ukrainian missiles, have been widely shared online. The ship went down in the Black Sea last week after Ukraine said it launched two Neptune missiles. Russia had, however, cited stormy seas as the reason, which the pictures seem to contradict.

274.title: Which cricketers from inaugural IPL match 14 years ago are still playing in IPL?
274.article_body: The first-ever IPL match took place on April 18, 2008 between KKR and RCB. KKR were led by Sourav Ganguly, while RCB were captained by Rahul Dravid. Virat Kohli and Wriddhiman Saha, who are playing in IPL 2022, also featured in the first-ever IPL match. Saha, who made his GT debut on Sunday, represented KKR in the inaugural match.

275.title: NASA shares picture of sunrise on Mars
275.article_body: NASA has shared a picture of the sunrise on Mars captured by its InSight lander. "On April 10, 2022, the 1198th sol (or Martian day) of its mission, our InSight lander took this photo of Martian dawn on the plains of Elysium Planitia," NASA said. InSight is NASA's first mission to study the interior of Mars in depth.

276.title: I'm happy South films are breaking into new territories: Anil Kapoor
276.article_body: Anil Kapoor said that the South has always been making "exceptional" films and added he is "happy" that South films are breaking into new territories. "I started my career with films down south and it gives me immense pleasure to see them doing so good," he stated. This comes after 'RRR', and 'Pushpa: The Rise' were commercial successes across India.

277.title: Ukraine has completed questionnaire for EU membership: Official
277.article_body: Ukraine has completed a questionnaire that will form the starting point for the European Union (EU) to consider the country's membership in the bloc, Ihor Zhovkva, Deputy Head of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's Office, said. Ukraine expects to acquire candidate country status for accession to the EU in June, Zhovkva added. Ukraine signed an application to join the EU in February.

278.title: Shocking and saddening: PM Modi on the demise of 18-year-old TT player Vishwa
278.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday tweeted, "The demise of TT champion Vishwa Deenadayalan is shocking and saddening." The 18-year-old table tennis player from Tamil Nadu died in a road accident on Sunday while travelling from Guwahati to Shillong for the 83rd Senior National and Inter-State Table Tennis Championship. PM Modi said Vishwa had distinguished himself in several competitions.

279.title: Who is Jammu fruit seller's son Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022?
279.article_body: SRH pacer Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022, was born on November 22, 1999 in Jammu and Kashmir. His father is a fruit seller. Umran was SRH's net bowler in IPL 2021 and he replaced T Natarajan in main squad after the latter was ruled out due to COVID-19. He was retained by SRH for ₹4 crore.

280.title: Never ever get a tattoo: Samantha to fan despite having 3 tattoos
280.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu held an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram Stories during which a fan asked for tattoo suggestions. The actress responded, "You know the one thing I'd tell my younger self is never ever get a tattoo. Never. Never ever. Ever, get a tattoo."  Samantha reportedly has three tattoos connected to her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya.

281.title: Training aircraft of pvt flying school topples on runway, 1 injured
281.article_body: A training aircraft of a private flying school toppled during landing at the Jakkur Aerodrome in Bengaluru on Sunday evening. An international skydiving champion, who was on the aircraft, received minor injuries as she was rescued by the pilot. The pilot reportedly spotted dogs and birds on the runway after landing and acted immediately.

282.title: 4 civilians shot dead in Ukraine's Luhansk region: Governor
282.article_body: Four civilians were reportedly shot dead during a Russian attack in Ukraine's eastern Luhansk region. The victims were trying to flee the Kreminna city by car when the incident occurred, said regional Governor Serhiy Gaidai in a Telegram post, according to a report. Meanwhile, multiple blasts were reported in Ukraine's Kyiv, Lviv and Dnipro regions.

283.title: Body of unidentified man found at Vasai beach in Palghar
283.article_body: The body of an unidentified man was found in a highly decomposed state at Vasai's Bhuigaon beach in Maharashtra's Palghar district. The body was spotted by fishermen and local people on Sunday evening, police said, adding that prima facie, the body was swept ashore by sea waves. A case of accidental death has been registered and an investigation is underway.

284.title: Noida is UP's crown just as Kashmir is India's crown: UP minister
284.article_body: UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta on Sunday said, "The way Kashmir...is a crown for India similarly, Noida is Uttar Pradesh's crown." Gupta made the comment during a visit to Noida on the occasion of the city's 47th foundation day. He inaugurated and laid foundation stones to projects worth ₹107 crore during the visit.

285.title: 20 injured after bus overturns in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar
285.article_body: A bus returning from a marriage party overturned on the Khuria Rahatgarh road in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Monday. According to the police, at least 20 passengers got injured after the bus skidded off the road. The bus, which was returning to Kesli, overturned after its driver, who later fled the spot, dozed off while driving, police said.

286.title: Stones pelted at ladies coach in Bandra, railway police file case
286.article_body: The railway police have suo motu registered a case following a tip-off about an alleged stone-pelting incident. According to police, a female commuter informed on a helpline that an unknown person pelted stones on a ladies' coach of a local train when it halted at Bandra station's platform seven. The train had, however, left when police reached the platform.

287.title: Ukrainian pilots launch 'buy me a jet' website to crowdfund war planes
287.article_body: Ukrainian pilots have launched a website 'buymeafighterjet.com' seeking crowdfunding to purchase new fighter jets amid the country's war with Russia. A video uploaded on the website showed destroyed Ukrainian military equipment and infrastructure while a pilot looks into the camera and said, "Buy me a fighter jet". As per the website, the average cost of a jet is $25 million.

288.title: SRK & Shehnaaz hug each other at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, video surfaces
288.article_body: Indian politician Baba Siddique hosted an annual Iftaar party at Hotel Taj Lands End in Mumbai's Bandra which was attended by several celebrities. Recently a video has surfaced online where Shehnaaz was all smiles as she hugged actor Shah Rukh Khan. For the party, Shehnaaz opted to wear a light grey Patiala suit along with matching jhumkas.

289.title: Tusshar congratulates Ranbir-Alia, says 'It was private wedding which I respect'
289.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor on Monday congratulated the newlywed Bollywood couple Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. "Very nice pictures, very natural. It was a private wedding which [I] respect," he said while talking to the media. "My best wishes from the family because Chintu Ji (Rishi Kapoor) was my father's (Jeetendra) close friend. So hearty wishes to them from...entire family," Tusshar added.

290.title: My 94*(51) vs CSK reminds me of my 2013 century for KXIP: Miller
290.article_body: After playing a match-winning knock of 94 runs against CSK, the Gujarat Titans batter David Miller said that this knock reminded him of his century which he scored for the Kings XI Punjab in 2013. "It does take me back to memory lane (referring to the 2013 knock)...with the rate quite high, I wanted to express myself (yesterday)," Miller said.

291.title: It was a minor incident: Police on fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri
291.article_body: The fresh stone-pelting in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where a communal violence broke out on Saturday, was a minor and one-off incident, police said on Monday. "Legal action is being taken. One person has been detained," it added. Police had earlier said that family members of an accused pelted two stones at a team when they went to question them.

292.title: Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara shares wedding pics
292.article_body: Actor Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara on Monday shared pictures from their wedding day on Instagram. She wrote, "With These 7 steps May you become my friend and May I deserve your friendship. May my friendship make me one with you and May your friendship make you one with me." The couple got married on April 15 in Alibaug.

293.title: People have wrong impression of Harsh Varrdhan that he's introvert: Anil on son
293.article_body: Speaking about his son, actor-producer Harsh Varrdhan, Anil Kapoor said people have this wrong impression of him that he's introverted and serious. "I was happy that media, critics and everybody praised his work and loved what he did [in AKvsAK]," he added. Speaking about his second collaboration with Harsh Varrdhan, Anil hilariously revealed Harsh Varrdhan rejected some of his suggestions.

294.title: Invited Macron to see evidence of ‘genocide’ in Ukraine: Zelenskyy
294.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he has invited his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron to visit Ukraine and see the evidence of 'genocide'. "I want him (Macron) to understand that this is not war, but...[a] genocide," Zelenskyy added. His comments come days after Macron refused to call the ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine a 'genocide' in an interview.

295.title: Watching Umran bowl at 150 clicks an hour is super exciting: Steyn
295.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad pace bowling coach Dale Steyn has said that watching the 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik "bowl at 150 clicks an hour consistently is super exciting". "Very often we try and create guys to make them more aware like changing your pace...But I think Umran is out and out raw. It's great to just let him loose," Steyn said.

296.title: 2 youths die after drowning in waterfall on Nagaon-Karbi Anglong border
296.article_body: Two youths lost their lives after  they drowned in a waterfall on Assam's Nagaon-Karbi Anglong district border. Police said that the deceased have been identified as Sajadul Islam and Raj Bora. Reports said that four people including the deceased had visited the waterfall and had gone missing. Police added that they reached the spot after getting information from the locals.

297.title: 3 masked men try to rob Ludhiana finance company’s office, manage to escape
297.article_body: Three masked men attempted to rob the office of a finance company in Ludhiana’s Raikot on Saturday. The manager of the firm said the robbers asked him to hand over almirah's keys to them. On resisting, the accused opened fire in the air. However, after the manager raised the alarm, the accused persons managed to escape.

298.title: Best hospitality in the world: Pietersen in Hindi before joining IPL commentary team
298.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen on Monday praised India in a tweet in Hindi ahead of joining the IPL commentary team and said, "Very excited to be back in India." He added, "Experiencing the best hospitality in the world is something I will never take lightly! See you in a few hours, India!"

299.title: They once had to eat samosas for breakfast: Rai on issues faced by India Women in 2017 WC
299.article_body: Talking about issues faced by India Women during 2017 World Cup, Vinod Rai revealed ahead of India's semi-final match against Australia, the players couldn't get the food they were supposed to. "They had to eat samosas for breakfast that morning!" Rai added that Harmanpreet Kaur, who scored 171* in that match, told him that she was cramping during her knock.

300.title: Bitcoin falls to lowest in a month, global crypto market's value falls to $1.9 trillion
300.article_body: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 4.2% to $38,580 and the second-largest cryptocurrency, Ether, dropped 4.7% to as low as $2,902 on Monday. The global crypto market’s value dropped about 4% in the past 24 hours to $1.9 trillion, according to the pricing from CoinGecko. Bitcoin has been struggling along with risk assets in recent months.

301.title: Keerthy congratulates Madhavan's son on bagging gold at Danish Open
301.article_body: Actress Keerthy Suresh took to Twitter to congratulate Madhavan's 16-year-old son Vedaant on winning a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. "Kudos to the champion Vedaant Madhavan. Your achievement is an inspiration to all! Congratulations to the proud father," she wrote. Vedaant won the medal in the 800m swimming event.

302.title: Sri Lanka Cricket asked to confirm on hosting Asia Cup by July 27: Report
302.article_body: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) board has been reportedly asked by the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) to decide on hosting the Asia Cup tournament by July 27. The tournament is scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka but the ongoing economic and political crisis in the country might take away the hosting rights from the SLC, a source said.

303.title: Party will decide on plan to expand, rejig Cabinet: K'taka CM
303.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said BJP President JP Nadda will hold a meeting regarding the state and thereafter decide on Karnataka Cabinet's expansion or reshuffle. This comes as BJP gears up for Karnataka Assembly polls which are scheduled to be held next year. There are currently 29 ministers in the state Cabinet against the sanctioned strength of 34.

304.title: Was never influenced by Salman Khan: 'Tere Naam' co-star Bhumika
304.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla, speaking about her 'Tere Naam' co-star Salman Khan, has said that she was never influenced by him "in any such manner". Bhumika added, "Salman has changed a lot, I see so much difference." "From what I hear...[Salman has] seen a kind of good growth in him as a person and even as an artist," she further stated.

305.title: I smeared henna all over my face at Alia-Ranbir's mehendi: Karan
305.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has revealed that he mistakenly smeared henna all over his face at Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's mehendi ceremony. He said that he had decided to get mehendi on his hands but wasn't used to it and tried wiping sweat from his face but smeared it with henna. "Alia's makeup artist...applied lotion on my face." Karan added.

306.title: Won’t accept N Korea’s escalating tests as normal: US envoy
306.article_body: A US official has called for a joint deterrent along with South Korea against North Korea's escalating weapons tests. "It is extremely important for the United Nations Security Council to send a clear signal to the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea) that we will not accept its escalatory tests as normal," said Sung Kim, US envoy on North Korea.

307.title: Mariupol doesn't exist anymore: Ukraine's Foreign Minister after Russian siege
307.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said the port city of Mariupol "doesn't exist anymore". "The situation in Mariupol is both dire militarily and heartbreaking. The city doesn't exist anymore," Kuleba told CBS News. "It seems from the way the Russian army behaves in Mariupol, they decided to raze the city to the ground at any cost,"  he added.

308.title: Curfew in 2 Amravati cities after stone-pelting incidents; 23 arrested
308.article_body: Curfew was imposed in Achalpur and Paratwada in Maharashtra's Amravati Rural after two groups pelted stones at each other allegedly over removal of religious flags on Sunday. Police have arrested 23 people for rioting. Three companies of the State Reserve Police Force (SRPF), 300 police personnel from Amravati Police and other security personnel have been deployed to keep vigil.

309.title: Can't ignore work: Bharti to trolls who criticised her for working post-pregnancy
309.article_body: Comedian-host Bharti Singh reacted to trolls who criticised her for working post-pregnancy. She reportedly said that she's not an angel who can rest forever. She added there are a lot of working women who leave their one-week-old kids at home to resume work. Bharti further said there are work commitments that one cannot ignore, hence work has to be resumed.

310.title: Have written a very strong story: Director Koratala Siva on 'NTR30'
310.article_body: Filmmaker Koratala Siva, speaking about his upcoming film with Jr NTR, has said, "Pre-production work currently going on...we're aiming to commence the shoot in June." "Have written a very strong story...which can reach a large set of audience" he added. The film is tentatively named 'NTR30'. Reportedly, Alia Bhatt was offered the female lead, however, she declined.

311.title: Captaincy comes naturally to Iyer, his mindset is clear: Ravi Shastri
311.article_body: Former India cricketer Ravi Shastri has said that "captaincy comes naturally" to KKR skipper Shreyas Iyer. "You don't feel like he's (Iyer) leading KKR for the first time. Looks like he's been captaining them for the last three-to-four seasons," Shastri said. "Iyer's mindset is clear about what brand of cricket he needs to play as a batter," he added.

312.title: Maoists kill 30-yr-old man who had come to meet relatives in Chhattisgarh
312.article_body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly killed by Maoists at Kolaiguda in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district in the early hours of Monday. The deceased has been identified as Dudhi Ganga. Ganga was a resident of Telangana and had run away from his village in Chhattisgarh years ago. He had come back to meet relatives at some function, police said.

313.title: Action to be taken without bias: Delhi Police Commissioner on Jahangirpuri violence
313.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Monday said that action will be taken without bias against all those found to be involved in the communal clashes in Jahangirpuri. "We will take action against whomever evidence of involvement is found during the investigation, irrespective of religion, creed, caste and community," Asthana said.

314.title: FIR not an encyclopedia of events: SC on HC granting bail to Ashish Mishra
314.article_body: The Supreme Court has cancelled the bail granted to Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra in the Lakhimpur case. Referring to Allahabad High Court's earlier order which granted bail to Ashish, it said, "FIR cannot be treated as an encyclopedia of events. Judicial precedents were ignored." It also said victims were denied the chance of an effective hearing.

315.title: Malaika returns to work after car accident, says 'feels good to be back'
315.article_body: Malaika Arora, who met with an accident on Mumbai-Pune highway earlier this month, shared on Monday that she has returned to work. Malaika, taking to Instagram Stories, shared a picture from a set, writing, "Feels good to be back on set." Malaika got into a car accident on April 2, following which she was taken to Apollo Hospital for treatment.

316.title: Kim Kardashian walks off Ellen's show following prank with spider
316.article_body: American television personality Kim Kardashian walked off comedienne Ellen DeGeneres' show after the latter pranked her with a fake spider. Ellen pretended to throw a spider out of its container while Kim ran away saying, "You're not doing this to me, I'm never going to get over it." Kim then walked out of the set waving and saying, "Bye, everyone!"

317.title: Citigroup initiates 'buy' rating on Paytm, raises target price by 32%
317.article_body: Citigroup Research has initiated 'buy' rating on Paytm owner One97 Communications and raised its target price to ₹910/share, up 32% from its current levels. Paytm's stock price has dropped nearly 70% from its IPO price of ₹2,150 led by regulatory headwinds and concerns about profitability. "Paytm has several potential levers to drive scale and improve profitability substantially," Citigroup said.

318.title: Only when Deepika entered my life, she made me appreciate living it: Ranveer
318.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he had zero work-life balance but things changed for the better. He added, "I had zero work-life balance for the longest time. It was only when Deepika (Padukone) came into my life that she made me appreciate living it." "She sits down with me and goes through my calendar to ensure the same," he said.

319.title: Tried to kill myself: Poonam after Munawar says mom died of suicide
319.article_body: Actress Poonam Pandey, who is a contestant on reality show 'Lock Upp', has revealed that she tried to kill herself many times. Poonam further said she saw herself in Munawar's mother as he had revealed that she suffered domestic abuse for years and that she wasn't happy. Munawar had revealed that his mother died of suicide.

320.title: No one realised how big IPL was going to become: Brendon McCullum
320.article_body: Recalling the first-ever IPL match in 2008, Brendon McCullum said no one realised how big the tournament was going to become. McCullum played for KKR in the first-ever match and scored an unbeaten 158 runs. Talking about his knock, he said, "It took me eight balls to start." McCullum remains the only KKR batter to score a century in IPL.

321.title: Microsoft joins e-commerce platform Udaan's $225 million debt round
321.article_body: E-commerce platform Udaan on Monday said Microsoft Corporation has joined its $225 million fundraising through sale of convertible debt. In an email to employees, Udaan CFO Aditya Pande said the firm's plan of mandatorily convertible notes to IPO highlights Udaan's capital strategy's evolution. The notes will be converted into equity when Udaan raises funds next or during its planned IPO.

322.title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints 17 ministers amid anti-govt protests
322.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday appointed 17 Cabinet ministers amid the anti-government protests owing to the economic crisis in the country. The new Cabinet reportedly has eight former ministers and several fresh entrants. This is the third Cabinet reshuffle in recent weeks. Earlier this month, as many as 26 ministers had resigned from the Cabinet.

323.title: Over 100 Islamist insurgents killed recently: Joint African forces
323.article_body: A joint military force of African countries, consisting of Nigeria, Niger and Cameroon, said on Sunday that they have killed over 100 Islamist insurgents in recent weeks. The killed insurgents included 10 commanders, it added. A joint task force spokesperson said that troops had entered deep into insurgent-controlled enclaves in Lake Chad area and recovered weapons, food and illicit drugs.

324.title: Wish you all the success, happiness: Suryakumar on Rahul's 30th birthday
324.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav took to Twitter to wish teammate KL Rahul on his 30th birthday on Monday. "Happy Birthday to one of the kindest...wish you all the success and happiness brother. Looking forward to many more partnerships with you," he wrote. Cheteshwar Pujara tweeted, "[Rahul] have a year as swashbuckling as your game."

325.title: KTR to inaugurate Hyd's Bahadurpura flyover on Apr 19
325.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao will inaugurate the Bahadurpura flyover in Hyderabad on April 19. The six-lane flyover from Bahadurpura Police Station to Nehru Zoological Park is expected to ease traffic congestion in the area. The flyover, which is a part of the Telangana government's Strategic Road Development Programme (SRDP), has been built at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore.

326.title: No attempt made to hoist saffron flag at mosque in Jahangirpuri: Police
326.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Monday said no attempt was made to hoist saffron flag at a mosque during the Hanuman Jayanti procession in Jahangirpuri on Saturday. "Some people are trying to disturb peace through the medium of social media," he said. The police chief added, "Legal action will be taken against those who are found spreading misinformation."

327.title: Hopefully, I start & finish here: Narine ahead of 150th match for KKR
327.article_body: Sunil Narine, who will play his 150th match for KKR against Rajasthan Royals today, has said, "I've always told Venky [Mysore, CEO]...hopefully, I don't play for any other franchise." "I've loved my stay at KKR, so hopefully I start and finish here," he added. Narine, who was bought by KKR in 2012, has taken 147 wickets in 140 IPL matches.

328.title: Spread teachings of gods in right way, don’t be 'andh bhakts': Maha CM
328.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said people should spread the teachings of their gods in the right way rather than becoming "andh bhakts". "The true follower will understand the teaching of his God and spread it to all. The blind follower will only praise superficially and then sometimes change his affection," Thackeray added.

329.title: Gurugram civic body to start repairing Sector 28 roads next month
329.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) plans to launch the repair of roads in Sector 28 next month, officials said on Sunday. The MCG has floated a tender worth ₹90 lakh for the work. Notably, a resident claimed that they have pursued the matter since 2013 and even pooled some money to repair a few stretches of the road.

330.title: Khurshid meets men who torched his home, says 'we decided to be friends'
330.article_body: Ex-Union Minister and Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Sunday shared a picture with the men who had set the entrance of his house on fire last year. "We talked and decided to be friends in peace. They felt bad about the event but went away pleased," said Khurshid. In November, Khurshid's Nainital house was vandalised amid controversy over his book.

331.title: Karisma Kapoor to star in Abhinay Deo's crime drama 'Brown'
331.article_body: Karisma Kapoor is set to play the lead role in a crime drama titled 'Brown'. The project, which is based on book 'City of Death' by Abheek Barua, will be directed by Abhinay Deo, who has previously helmed films like 'Delhi Belly' and 'Force 2'. Karisma took to Instagram to share some pictures from set and wrote, "To new beginnings."

332.title: Moving in small Mumbai flat was challenge, mother couldn't 'breathe': Poonam
332.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon said that moving into a small flat in Mumbai was a challenge after living in Chandigarh. "Initially, my mother said she couldn't 'breathe' in Mumbai...In Chandigarh...I biked to school, to the swimming club and elsewhere. I hadn't seen local trains or buses. The infrastructure of the city and the population was a kind of shock," she added.

333.title: South Korean band BTS' new album to release on June 10
333.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' new album will release on June 10, the band's agency Big Hit Music said in a statement. "Details on the new album will be provided in a separate notice at a later date," the statement further read. In a teaser video posted on social media, BTS announced the album with the tagline 'We Are Bulletproof'.

334.title: Navi Mumbai corporator holds 'chai pe charcha' with citizens
334.article_body: Navi Mumbai corporator Vikrant Patil held 'chai pe charcha' to discuss issues faced by local residents. He held discussions on various issues such as roads, nallas, parks, municipal works, jobs and admissions in schools and colleges. A large number of citizens attended the event held at Patil's office.

335.title: Man dies by suicide after killing his family in UP's Ghazipur
335.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after killing his wife and two children in the Sadat Bazaar area of Ghazipur in Uttar Pradesh. According to the local police sub-inspector Mahendra Yadav, the accused, identified as Shivdas Sonekar, killed his wife Reena (30) and two children, aged five and three years, by smothering them with a pillow.

336.title: Amway India's assets worth ₹758 crore attached by ED over pyramid fraud
336.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹757.77 crore belonging to Amway India Enterprises Private Limited. According to ED, the firm was running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing networks. The attached properties include Amway's land and factory building in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul district, plant and machinery, vehicles, bank accounts and FDs.

337.title: Javed Miandad was the first batsman to win an ODI with last-ball six
337.article_body: Former Pakistani captain Javed Miandad was the first-ever batsman to help his team win an ODI by hitting a six off the match's last ball. Miandad achieved the feat against India on April 18, 1986 by hitting a maximum on the bowling of then 20-year-old fast bowler Chetan Sharma. Pakistan won that match by one wicket.

338.title: Told Nike this was not on: Rai on women cricketers' jerseys being made from men's kits
338.article_body: Ex-CoA Chairman Vinod Rai, in a recent interview, said that women cricketers had not been taken seriously in India till around 2006. He added, "I was aghast to know...men's uniforms were being cut up and re-stitched for women's players. I had to ring up Nike and tell them that this wasn't on and that their design would be different."

339.title: Sensex crashes 1,170 points to end at 57,166 dragged by IT stocks
339.article_body: The Sensex plunged 1,172 points on Monday to close at 57,166, while the Nifty fell 302 points to end below 17,200, at 17,173. Most sectoral indices were trading lower today with the IT index declining nearly 5%, and realty and bank indices down 1% each. Infosys, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra and Apollo Hospitals were among the top Nifty losers.

340.title: Hyderabad's 216-year-old heritage monument to be reopened for public in May
340.article_body: The 216-year-old British Residency in Hyderabad will be reopened for the public in May, state Archaeology Minister V Srinivas Goud announced. According to the local heritage activists, since 2013, the monument was undergoing restoration work which was taken up by the World Monuments Fund. Notably, the residency served as a seat of power for the British in Hyderabad before independence.

341.title: Will target Israel's heart if it acts against Iran: Prez Raisi
341.article_body: Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi has warned Israel of a military response if it acts against the Islamic nation. "If you [Israel] take the slightest move against our nation, our armed forces will target the heart of the Zionist regime," said Raisi. This comes after Israel said it will not accept Iran as "a nuclear threshold state".

342.title: I don't own a home, I stay at friends' places: World's richest man Elon Musk
342.article_body: Elon Musk, the world's richest person with a net worth of over $250 billion, said, "I don't even own a home right now...I'm literally staying at friends' places." He added, "If I travel to the Bay Area, which is where most of Tesla engineering is, I basically rotate through friends' spare bedrooms." Musk also said, "I don't have a yacht."

343.title: Miller played shots from the top of the cover vs CSK, he'll be dangerous: Sachin
343.article_body: Talking about GT batter David Miller's unbeaten 94-run innings against CSK, Sachin Tendulkar said if the South Africa batter's "good phase" continues, then he'll be a very dangerous batter in the ongoing IPL season. "Because he played most of his game towards mid-wicket. He played shots from the top of the cover, which means he's absolutely in control," explained Tendulkar.

344.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar becomes first Indian fast bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL
344.article_body: SRH fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar has become the first Indian fast bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL. The 32-year-old achieved the feat after registering figures of 4-0-22-3 against PBKS on Sunday. Jasprit Bumrah is the second highest wicket-taker in IPL among Indian fast bowler with 134 scalps. Bhuvneshwar and Bumrah are followed by Umesh Yadav with 129 wickets.

345.title: Only hundred by a KKR player was hit in the 1st-ever IPL match
345.article_body: Brendon McCullum smashed the only hundred by a KKR player in the first-ever IPL match against RCB at Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru on April 18, 2008. He slammed 158* off 73 balls, including 13 sixes and 10 fours. It remained the highest IPL score till Chris Gayle slammed 175*(66) against PWI in 2013.

346.title: I'm married: Prince after Azma comments on his past equation with Nora Fatehi
346.article_body: In a new promo, 'Lock Upp' contestant Azma Fallah was seen making a comment about Prince Narula's equation with Nora Fatehi from the time they appeared together on 'Bigg Boss 9'. She said, "Prince Narula didn't get...attention from Nora Fatehi." Reacting to Azma's comment, Prince said, "It'll be...bad if you get personal again. I'm a married man. Shut up."

347.title: Every IPL season, Samson starts with a bang & then just tapers off: Aakash
347.article_body: Aakash Chopra has opined that Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson needs to play a captain's knock in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Every season, Samson starts with a bang and then just tapers off," Aakash stated. "Time has come for him to lift himself and the team as well," he added. Samson has scored 117 runs in five matches so far.

348.title: Ex-BJP ward member shot dead in Odisha; accused's family attacked
348.article_body: A 56-year-old former BJP ward member was shot dead following a dispute over a pond in Odisha's Dhenkanal on Sunday. In response, the victim's family, along with their supporters, attacked the accused's family and torched their house, causing serious injuries to accused's wife and three-year-old son, police said. Dhenkanal BJP leader Ramchandra Patra claimed it to be a political killing.

349.title: PBKS skipper Mayank is better, he should be ready to be back: Dhawan
349.article_body: Punjab Kings batter Shikhar Dhawan, speaking about skipper Mayank Agarwal's injury, has said, "Mayank is better and he should be ready to be back." Mayank did not feature in the match against SunRisers Hyderabad due to a toe injury and Dhawan was named the stand-in captain. SRH defeated Punjab in the match by seven wickets.

350.title: Dhoni's mindset was to look at team, never dwelled on his own performance: Gary Kirsten
350.article_body: Ex-India coach Gary Kirsten has called ex-India captain MS Dhoni the "ultimate team player". Kirsten added, "As a captain, Dhoni's mindset was always to look at the team first and see the way the team could be thriving. He never dwelled on his own performances."
