It was during Gary's stint with Dhoni that India won the 2011 World Cup.

351.title: Hyd Police seize ganja worth ₹1 crore, arrest 2 suspected peddlers
351.article_body: Hyderabad’s Rachakonda Police on Friday arrested two suspected interstate drug traffickers and seized 700 kg ganja worth ₹1 crore from their possession. Police intercepted the lorry carrying the contraband, which was en route to Rajasthan from Andhra Pradesh, near Hyderabad. The drugs were concealed inside the lorry, which was loaded with plywood and home decor sheets, reports stated.

352.title: Was signed as lead in 'Kumkum Bhagya', was very adamant to play it: Mrunal
352.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur said she was signed to play the lead role in the television serial 'Kumkum Bhagya' but it eventually turned into the second lead space. "I realised it didn't matter because I still won immense popularity...What matters is what impact you leave on audience...whosoever is the lead character...at times, other characters are ones with more drama," she added.

353.title: UP makes face masks compulsory in Lucknow, NCR amid COVID-19 surge
353.article_body: In view of the increase in COVID-19 cases in India, the Uttar Pradesh government on Monday made it mandatory for people to wear a face mask in public places in the capital city of Lucknow and six NCR districts. People in Gautam Buddha Nagar, Ghaziabad, Hapur, Meerut, Bulandshahr and Baghpat will also have to compulsorily wear face masks.

354.title: Shakti Kapoor shares pic with Ranjeet and Asrani among others
354.article_body: Veteran actor Shakti Kapoor on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture with veteran actors Ranjeet, Dilip Joshi, Rakesh Bedi, Puneet Issar and Asrani. He captioned the picture, "Last eve was nice meeting old friends." A social media user commented on Shakti's post, "Peripona to all our legends," while another one wrote, "Fantastic frame of friendship."

355.title: Enjoyed my debut game for Sussex: Pujara on 201* in county cricket
355.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara, who scored a double ton in County Championship Division Two, said he enjoyed his debut game for Sussex and was glad to contribute to the team's cause. In response to Derbyshire's 505 first-innings total, Sussex got bundled out for 174 before Pujara (201*) and Tom Haines (243) scored double tons to draw the match.

356.title: Good governance begins in the founders' heads: Info Edge Founder
356.article_body: Info Edge Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani tweeted, "Good governance begins in the founders' heads. No amount of oversight...can ensure a company is well governed if the founders are not committed." He added, "If you are better governed, you will sleep more peacefully at night." Bikhchandani's comments come after Sequoia Capital India published a blog on the need for better corporate governance.

357.title: Tribal woman out to collect vegetables in forest attacked by bear in Tripura
357.article_body: A 45-year-old tribal woman was attacked by a wild bear in Tripura when she went into a forest area to collect tubers and vegetables. Reports said local youth spotted the woman and shifted her to a local hospital. One of her neighbours said that she was bleeding profusely. She suffered cuts on her face and other parts of her body.

358.title: Torture chambers built by Russian troops in southern Ukraine: Zelenskyy
358.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said Russian troops in southern Ukraine have been carrying out torture and kidnappings. "Torture chambers are built there. They abduct representatives of local governments and anyone deemed visible to local communities," he said in an address to the nation. Zelenskyy said that humanitarian aid has been stolen, creating famine.

359.title: Swiggy, Zomato back startup UrbanPiper in $24 mn funding round
359.article_body: Restaurant management platform UrbanPiper has raised $24 million in a funding round led by existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Tiger Global, along with new investors Swiggy and Zomato. The Bengaluru-based startup is a B2B software platform with over 27,000 hotels and restaurants live on its platform. UrbanPiper claims to process 18% of all online food orders in India.

360.title: Can't wait for the exceptional ride: Johar on trailer of Ajay's 'Runway 34'
360.article_body: Karan Johar has praised the trailer of Ajay Devgn's upcoming film 'Runway 34', writing on Twitter, "Breathtaking and thrilling." "Cannot wait for the exceptional ride...An intriguing edge of the seat story and the perfect summer film," he added. Ajay thanked Karan and wrote, "That's a really cool compliment...I would like for you to see the film, when...first copy is out."

361.title: 50 Russian artists' paintings stuck in S Korea due to sanctions
361.article_body: Paintings by around 50 Russian artists which were loaned to Sejong Museum of Art in South Korea's Seoul are stuck there due to sanctions imposed by multiple countries amid Russia-Ukraine conflict, organisers said on Monday. The situation has been caused as all flights to Moscow have been shut due to sanctions, AFP reported. The paintings were loaned for an exhibition.

362.title: L&T Infotech, Mindtree may merge into a $22 billion firm: Report
362.article_body: Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between its publicly traded software firms, Larsen & Toubro Infotech and Mindtree, to create a $22 billion firm, Bloomberg reported. The boards of the two companies could consider share swap ratios for the merger as early as next week. L&T acquired Mindtree in 2019 and holds about a 61% stake in the company.

363.title: Fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri, police attacked by relatives of accused
363.article_body: Stones were pelted at a police team on Monday near the site of Saturday's communal violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. As per police, family members of an accused pelted two stones at the team when they went to question them and one person has been detained. As many as 23 people have so far been arrested in connection to Saturday's incident.

364.title: Anywhere with you: Athiya Shetty wishes boyfriend KL Rahul on b'day
364.article_body: Actress Athiya Shetty wished her boyfriend, cricketer KL Rahul on his 30th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Athiya posted several monochrome photos of them. In the first picture, Athiya is seen holding KL Rahul as they posed for the camera. Alongside the post, she wrote, "Anywhere with you, happy birthday." Reacting to the post, KL Rahul commented, "Love you."

365.title: Byculla Zoo sees 50,000 visitors over long weekend, collects ₹24 lakh
365.article_body: Nearly 50,000 people visited the Byculla Zoo in Mumbai over the long weekend and it earned a revenue of over ₹24 lakh, officials said. Around 20,478 people came to the zoo on Sunday alone. The zoo, which is open from 9.30 am to 5 pm on all days, charges an entry fee of ₹50 per person.

366.title: ₹48,000 cr wiped off Infosys' m-cap in a day as shares plunge the most in 2 years
366.article_body: The shares of Infosys plunged over 9% on Monday during the intra-day trade, wiping out ₹48,000 crore from the company's market capital. At 9%, Infosys stock had the biggest fall in the market since March 23, 2020. This comes after several analysts cut Infosys margin estimates over its weaker-than-expected earnings for the March quarter.

367.title: Manish Sisodia shares Guj govt schools' pics 'without desks', 'broken toilets'
367.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi’s visit to Gujarat, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia tweeted pictures of government schools in Gujarat "without desks" and "broken toilets". "Dear PM, you may not see the pictures of these schools from the modern centre of Vidya Samiksha Kendra, where there is no desk to sit, there are spider webs...Toilets are broken," Sisodia tweeted.

368.title: 16 wagons of goods train derail in Punjab's Rupnagar
368.article_body: A train with 16 wagons, that was coming from Ropar Thermal Plant, derailed in Punjab's Rupnagar. The incident took place after driver applied brakes suddenly after a herd of cattle came on the railway tracks. DRM Ambala said that few express and passenger trains have been cancelled after the incident.

369.title: We didn't capitalise on what was a very good base while batting: Fleming
369.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said they couldn't capitalise in the last five overs while batting against GT on Sunday. Fleming added, "Two contributing factors [towards our defeat] were outstanding innings from David Miller and a very good cameo from Rashid Khan." He further said, "It's a hard one...we were in control...so, losing from there is very hard."

370.title: Both murders were planned: Kerala ADGP on SDPI & RSS workers' killings
370.article_body: After an SDPI worker and an RSS worker were killed in Kerala's Palakkad, ADGP Law and Order, Vijay Sakhare, on Monday said that undoubtedly, both the murders were "planned". "There was a conspiracy behind both the murders. We have a fair idea about who are the accused persons," Sakhare added. "The suspects will be caught soon," Sakhare stated.

371.title: WPI inflation rises to record 14.55% in Mar, Govt cites Russia-Ukraine war as reason
371.article_body: India's Wholesale Price-based Inflation (WPI) has surged to a record high of 14.55% in March. The Centre has said that the high rate of inflation in March is due to "the rise in prices of crude petroleum and natural gas, mineral oils, basic metals" caused by the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Notably, In March 2021, the WPI was 7.89%.

372.title: Umran's pace means I'm a target, batters think I'm slower: Bhuvneshwar
372.article_body: On being asked how his SRH teammate Umran Malik's pace has helped him in the ongoing IPL, veteran pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar jokingly said, "More than helping me...I'm a target as batters think I'm slower." Bhuvneshwar also praised Umran, stating that watching the 22-year-old in action is "joy". "Hope the [batters] going after me leads to wickets...not boundaries," he added.

373.title: VHP’s Surendra Jain seeks NIA probe into Jahangirpuri violence
373.article_body: VHP’s Surendra Jain has demanded a probe by the NIA into the Jahangirpuri violence that took place in Delhi on Hanuman Jayanti. "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has become the sleeper cell of terrorists today. My demand is from the Central government that an investigation should be done by the NIA because it involves the issue of national security," Jain added.

374.title: 2 killed as BJP MLA's Scorpio rams into motorcycle in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
374.article_body: Two men were killed when their motorcycle and a Scorpio car collided head-on in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri, police said. Police added that the Scorpio car is said to belong to Lakhimpur Kheri Sadar MLA Yogesh Verma. Reports said that the SUV is registered in the name of MLA's wife Neelam Verma. Police took the Scorpio driver into its custody.

375.title: Rescued tiger jumps into water during release in Sundarbans, old video resurfaces
375.article_body: IFS Officer Parveen Kaswan on Sunday shared an old video that captured the release of a rescued tiger that jumped and swam away from a boat in Sundarbans. Sharing the video, he wrote, "That tiger sized jump though." A user commented on the video, "Reminds me of Life of Pi!" Another tweeted, "It's swimming like an expert fish."

376.title: Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste to make acting debut with The Color Purple
376.article_body: Multiple Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste is set to make his feature acting debut with 'The Color Purple'. Blitz Bazawule, the filmmaker behind Beyoncé's 'Black Is King', will direct the upcoming project. In addition to Batiste, 'The Color Purple' will also feature Taraji P. Henson, Fantasia Barrino, Danielle Brooks, Colman Domingo, Corey Hawkins and others.

377.title: Man who set self on fire at Punjab police station dies; 11 booked
377.article_body: Eleven people, including a municipal councillor, have been booked after a 35-year-old man who set himself on fire at a police station in Punjab's Kapurthala died at a hospital on Sunday, police said. The deceased had claimed that the officials aren't acting on his complaint about his wife not being allowed to leave prostitution. The incident had occurred last week.

378.title: Which cricketers have bowled 20th over of an innings as maiden in IPL history?
378.article_body: SRH pacer Umran Malik became the fourth bowler to record the 20th over of an innings as maiden in IPL after conceding no runs and taking three wickets in PBKS' 20th over. Irfan Pathan bowled the 20th over as maiden, while representing KXIP against MI in 2008. Other bowlers to do so are Lasith Malinga (2009) and Jaydev Unadkat (2017).

379.title: Sleeper cells trained by police: Kerala BJP Vice President on RSS worker’s killing
379.article_body: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan claimed that there are "sleeper cells" in the police force receiving training from police and armed forces. His remark came after an RSS worker was killed in Palakkad. "Primary duty of the state is to protect the life and property of citizens. But a murder happened within the vicinity of the police," Radhakrishnan added.

380.title: Car returning from marriage party hits truck in Amethi; 6 dead, 4 injured
380.article_body: A Bolero car returning from a wedding ceremony collided with a truck in Amethi, Uttar Pradesh on Sunday. According to SP Dinesh Singh, the accident, which took place around midnight in the Gauriganj area, claimed the lives of six people, including an 8-year-old boy, and injured four. Notably, the Bolero was returning from Rae Bareli's Nasirabad area, police said.

381.title: Man clicks obscene pics of wife, circulates them in B'luru; booked
381.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly taking obscene pictures of his wife and blackmailing her in Bengaluru, police said on Monday. The man had reportedly demanded that his wife give him money and when she refused, he circulated the pictures to his friends. The complainant claimed that the accused had also tortured her to sleep with his friend.

382.title: Was surprised Sonu Sood knew about me; it was a fan moment: Karan Kundrra
382.article_body: Karan Kundrra reacted after actor Sonu Sood praised him by calling him "a tough guy". In an interview, replying to a question on Neha and Karan, Sonu said, "Karan Kundrra is more bad***...I'd say he's a tough guy." Reacting to it, Karan tweeted, "I didn't even know...Sonu paaji (brother) knew who I was...this [was] like a fan moment for me."

383.title: What is the state-wise active COVID-19 case tally as daily cases jump nearly 90%?
383.article_body: India recorded 2,183 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, an 89.8% jump from 1,150 cases reported a day before. In terms of active COVID-19 cases, Kerala has 2,466 cases, Delhi has 1,518, Karnataka has 1,506 and Assam has 1,349. While Haryana has 911 active cases, it is followed by Maharashtra with 646 cases and Uttar Pradesh with 610 cases.

384.title: Burglars enter Pune house via exhaust fan window, steal items worth Rs 86,000
384.article_body: Tanmay Kulkarni from Pune has lodged an FIR in a case where burglars entered his house, which is in front of a police station, through exhaust fan window and stole valuables worth ₹86,000, including some gold ornaments, a music system, laptop, and iPod. Police, in press release, said that Kulkarni had gone out with his wife when burglars entered house.

385.title: 27-year-old history-sheeter arrested in Mumbai; pistol, knives seized
385.article_body: A history-sheeter (27), accused in an October 2020 murder case, was arrested by the Mumbai Crime Branch's Unit-7 in Ghatkopar. The police seized a country-made pistol and two knives from the accused, who is identified as Amol Avate. He was allegedly involved in the murder of Ambadas Salve, a resident of Vikhroli (east), along with five other people, police said.

386.title: Hong Kong bans Air India flights till April 24 after 3 found COVID positive
386.article_body: Hong Kong has banned Air India services till April 24 after three passengers on one of its flights tested positive for COVID-19 post arrival on Saturday, an official said. "Due to restrictions imposed by Hong Kong authorities and limited demand on the sector, our flights to Hong Kong & back of 19th and 23rd April stand cancelled," Air India tweeted.

387.title: I don't remember seeing Dhoni losing too many games like this: Vaughan
387.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan questioned Ravindra Jadeja's captaincy after CSK's fifth loss in six games in the ongoing IPL season and said that he doesn't remember ex-captain MS Dhoni losing too many games like this. "Honestly, it wasn't a tight game [against GT] and they lost it. They should've easily won that game by 10 or 15 runs," he added.

388.title: Pujara smashes double hundred on Sussex debut, ends 52-innings century drought
388.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 201*(387) against Derbyshire on his debut for Sussex in County Championship Division Two. With this, Pujara became only the second Indian to score a double century in the County Championship after Mohammed Azharuddin. Pujara smashed a first-class hundred after going 52 innings without a ton.

389.title: Intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably: VD Satheesan
389.article_body: Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state's intelligence system in the wake of the last week's back-to-back political killings in Palakkad. "Attempts are being made in Kerala for communal polarization. The victims are ordinary people and the conspirators are laughing. The intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably," the Congress leader said.

390.title: TN girl kills neighbour for jewellery, says 'parents didn't buy ornaments'
390.article_body: 17-year-old, class 12 girl student has been arrested for allegedly strangling her 76-year-old neighbour and stealing 21-sovereign gold from the woman's house in Tamil Nadu. The girl said she murdered the woman for jewellery because her parents are daily wagers and haven't bought gold ornaments to save for her wedding. Incident came to light when woman's daughter found her dead.

391.title: Shelling killed 18, injured 100 in Kharkiv in 4 days: Ukraine Prez
391.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that Russia's shelling is "constant" in Kharkiv and 18 people were killed in the past four days due to it. He added that over 100 people were also injured due to the shelling in the same period. "This is nothing but deliberate terror: mortars, artillery against ordinary residential quarters," he further said.

392.title: 5 arrested for hoisting saffron flag on dargah in Gujarat
392.article_body: Five persons were arrested and a juvenile was detained for allegedly hoisting a saffron flag on a dargah during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Gujarat's Veraval. According to police, when the procession was passing by Magrebisha Bapu's dargah, some men "entered the dargah premises and hoisted a 'bhagva' (saffron) flag on the roof of the toilet block".

393.title: Received ₹500 as my 1st pay for working as a hostess at a conference: Samantha
393.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu during a Q&A session on Instagram revealed that her first income was ₹500 which she had received as a hostess for an eight-hour shift at a conference in a hotel. She added that she was in Class 10 or 11 at that time. Born in Chennai, Samantha attended St Stephen's Matriculation School in Pallavaram.

394.title: Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar’s wife dies by suicide
394.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar's wife died by suicide in Mumbai's Kurla on Sunday. The 42-year-old, Rajni Kudalkar, was reportedly found hanging in the kitchen of her house by a family member who called the police. The police said they are trying to find out the reason behind the incident and will record statements of the family members.

395.title: Manish Malhotra shares pic of Alia in her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make
395.article_body: Fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared a picture of Alia Bhatt wearing her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make. "Alia...chose to personalise [the] ensemble with...sustainable approach...where approximately 180 textiles patches come together to mark her momentous occasion," he wrote. "The custom touches reminisce about her journey and depict symbolic elements of her memories," he added.

396.title: TV actor Vivian to marry ex-journalist from Egypt, 5 years after his split with Vahbiz
396.article_body: TV actor Vivian Dsena has revealed that he is planning to tie the knot with Nouran Aly, a former journalist from Egypt. "We first interacted around four-and-a-half years ago, when she contacted me for an interview," Vivian said. Vivian was earlier married to TV actress Vahbiz Dorabjee. They split five years ago and finalised their divorce in December 2021.

397.title: Blue is the only jersey missing: Harbhajan on SRH pacer Umran Malik
397.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has termed SRH's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik as the "most deserving one" among the uncapped players to be selected for India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Blue is the only jersey missing and he should get it early...He could be your match-winner [in Australia]," stated Harbhajan. Umran has picked nine wickets in six games this season.

398.title: Attacks on processions designed way to divide country: JP Nadda
398.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday said that the Congress party is behaving in the most irresponsible manner. Addressing the party workers in Karnataka's Hosapete, Nadda said, "You must have seen the attacks on Ram Navami procession or something else at some other place...I can say it's a designed way to divide the country," Nadda added.

399.title: Rahul Gandhi lacks stability, can't be entrusted with responsibilities: PJ Kurien
399.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is a leader who has “no stability” and cannot be entrusted with responsibilities, senior party leader PJ Kurien said. "The captain cannot leave the ship when it is in trouble. After the 2019 elections, he resigned abruptly from the post (of Congress chief). But, he continues to take important decisions in the party," Kurien added.

400.title: Met Salman as kid; he was eating from tandoor, mom made us stand with him: Neha
400.article_body: Singer Neha Bhasin said that she first met actor Salman Khan when she was a child. In an interview with Bollywood Hungama, she said that she has picture of the meeting and that Salman was standing near a tandoor and eating something from it. "My mom made us stand with him. Me and my sister were looking silly," she added.

401.title: Aamir dances to Dhol Jageero Da with influencer Ruhee Dosani, she shares video
401.article_body: Social media influencer Ruhee Dosani took to Instagram to share a video of herself dancing with Aamir Khan to the song 'Dhol Jageero Da'. Aamir had invited Ruhee and her family to his house. "Still don't know how to...process the fact that Aamir sir was so kind to agree to spend time with my family to celebrate Vaisakhi," Ruhee wrote.

402.title: 2 killed, 17 injured in separate shootings in US
402.article_body: Two people were killed and at least 17 injured in two separate incidents of mass shooting in US over the Easter weekend. A shooting at a nightclub in South Carolina left nine people injured, while another in Pittsburgh left two dead and eight wounded. These happened a day after 14 people were injured in a shooting incident in South Carolina.

403.title: After silver, Madhavan's son Vedaant wins gold at Danish Open; actor shares video
403.article_body: Actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant has bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. Vedaant won the medal in the 800 m swimming event and clocked 8:17:28. Sharing a video of the felicitation ceremony, Madhavan wrote, "GOLD….With all your blessings and God's greatest...winning streak continues." Earlier, he had won a silver medal in a different category.

404.title: 'Social Media Lab' activated in Maha, 3,000 posts inciting communal tensions deleted
404.article_body: Mumbai Police on Monday said that a 'Social Media Lab' has been activated to keep a vigil on posts that could incite communal tensions in Maharashtra. Mumbai Police added that around 3,000 such posts have been deleted till now. Notably, Maharashtra government has decided to allow the use of loudspeakers at religious sites only with due permission, ANI reported.
